Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the Bayside”
Reviews.Author: happyg68
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel on the bay, with great access to Petco, Gaslamp and the Convention Center. Our first stay in this property while we were at a convention. There is a dedicated bridge over the main street and rail lines that put you right at Petco and a couple of blocks from the Gaslamp District, so only did cabs a couple of times when we were going outside of that area. Rooms were nice and spacious, Pools is big and screened from the wind. Vela and Odysea are both very nice venues for a drink or snack and the main restaurant was fine for breakfast and lunch. Big caveat is that you want a room on the bay / convention center side. That was automatic for Hilton Honors and an upgrade for others. The back side is an industrial view. Also, slightly annoying is that the pool abute a Dole unloading facility which is noisy and active when a ship comes in. You won't hear it in the room, but if you are at the pool or outdoor at the two bars, it will be noticable. Overall, a litte nicer and newer than the Marriott down the road where I stayed last time, but equal to the Hyatt next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but kind of isolated”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you would expect from a Hilton, and the rooms with views are amazing. It is in a great location in terms of the views and if you want to walk along the bayfront, as the name indicates. The rooms are lovely and the service was good. I was there for a conference, and was a bit disappointed at the lack of restaurants in the immediate area. When you have limited time to eat lunch, it would be nice to have a couple of places nearby, but the hotel is on the opposite side of the train tracks from the gaslamp district, so you have to walk 10 or 15 minutes just to find a sandwich. The hotel restaurant is not that great and fairly expensive. When we were there for the conference, the Starbucks at the bottom of the hotel was always packed, but you couldn't find another coffee shop that was close by, so the hotel felt isolated. If I were coming as a tourist but looking for a similar experience, I'd stay at the Hilton Gaslamp instead, mainly for the proximity to restaurants, etc. The Gaslamp area is nice with a lot going on in the evenings. I also found it a bit frustrating how expensive parking was, even though that is relatively standard for this type of hotel. It was nearly $30 per day. You could park at the convention center for only $10, and that is right next door! Additionally, they charge for a refrigerator in the room. Again, standard for this kind of hotel (but I had recently stayed at the Sheraton in La Jolla which was actually just as nice as this hotel and included a free fridge). It just annoyed me that they were nickel-and-diming when the hotel is so expensive in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a conference - Stylish lobby”
Reviews.Author: Fiend
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Front desk staff courteous and concierge relatively well informed. Rooms adequate but not over the top. I also ended up with a "roof view," so nothing to write home about. The Starbucks, sports bar, and yogurt place are in the same building but only accessible from outside the hotel, which was inconvenient because I was in San Diego the week in March where it poured rain and was frequently 50+ degrees outside. Would stay again here if I had a conference, but might consider some place closer to the Gaslamp quarter next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hilton Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: drm02
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. There were so many things to do within a short walking distance. I got up every morning and walked along the water. The staff was very nice and helfpul! The rooms were perfect sized! Our view was outstanding. We didnt have our children with us but it was definately a kid friendly hotel. No complaints about this hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, awesome view”
Reviews.Author: MMV_RJ
Reviews.Content: Went to Sand Diego for a conference and I stayed both at this hotel and at the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter (located a couple blocks of distance). I think I like the Gaslamp Quarter better (stayed there for 5 nights and only 1 at the Bayfront), but I must say it was a very good stay. The conference was almost totally held at the Bayfront, so I spent most of my other 5 days there. Nice property, bright, clean, and equipped with bars and snackplaces everywhere. But the view, man, the view. You can spend the whole day at the bar and just watch the bay. Well, one more thing to make me come back to town. The location is OK. Although it is within walking distance from the main attractions at the Gaslamp Quarter, it is still a long walk from the hotel. And I did not feel that confortable crossing the railroad everytime I wanted to go to the city (there was no major disturbance, though). The room was big and very clean. Mine faced the port, so i did not have the amazing view that others may have (the ones facing the marine). However, as I did not spend much time there, it did make no difference to me. Overall, the room was very good, as we had wireless internet access, a vending machine a few yards down the hall and a very functional workstation in the room. Did not have the time to enjoy the gym or to hang out at the pool (probably someone who will stay there for more time than me may remind that hint, the pool is beautiful and it faces the sea. It's a must go). The breakfast was OK. Did not have any complaints, but there was also nothing to make it remarkful. Staff was very nice. I would seriously consider this property next time I am at town.

Reviews.Title: “reliable quality”
Reviews.Author: LardB0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights here for a conference in April 2012. Hotel did its job very satisfactorily. Shared a room with a colleague and there was plenty of space, excellent facilities and a nice view. Staff we encountered were all friendly and helpful, Facilities as you would expect from a convention Hilton. Possibly slightly lacking in character, but that comes with the territory I suppose. Lovely location on the bay, with nice walks up and down the coast and handy for the 'Gaslamp' district for food and bars and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with some unnecessary charges”
Reviews.Author: MarsBar68
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel so you don't get that personal touch that you do in a smaller hotel. Having said that all staff encountered were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located a little bit away from the main gaslight area and Shoreline Village compared to the Marriott but a nice walk to each is possible. A footbridge links the hotel to Petco Park - home of the San Diego Padres. Positives. Great beds. We had a queen room and the beds were so comfy and we slept really well. Breakfast: massive selection and good quality. Only downside was that we had to ask for fresh orange juice 3 times on the morning we had breakfast. Great views from the hotel. We were on the 27th floor. Negatives: We had to pay for Wifi. Having stayed in 5 hotels in California during our holiday, this was the only hotel we had to pay for Wifi ($13.95 for 24 hours). Housekeeping made an error with our laundry by telling us that we would get it back in 24 hours even though this 24 hours included Easter Sunday. Inevitably it did not arrive back on Easter Sunday so we had to wait until 10.00 am on Monday to get it Ba ck which then delayed our departure by 2 hours. The laundry charge was reimbursed. If you use the laundry, double check if there is a planned bank holiday. Always seemed to be a queue at reception. Although it appears there are more negatives than positives, on the whole the hotel is fine except for charging for wifi. Where we encountered problems, they were dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice when attending a conference. Each time the service was outstanding. I had a room with a great view of the Bay and the Convention Center. My room was clean and odor free. Loved having Starbucks coffee every morning. Could use more TV channels Will be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful property, breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler036
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for a business trip- a convention in april 2012, i also brought my 13 year old daughter with me. everything from check-in to check-out was smoothless, we had a wonderful room on the 15th floor with all of san diego bay and city in front of us. the room was large, had very comfortable beds- so even though we flew 14 hours and had a ten hour time difference, neither me nor my daughter lost any sleep. all the staff -reception, breakfast lounge, house keeping- were very helpful, friendly, always with a smile. This particularly needs to be mentioned because the hotel was hosting a convention for 5000-6000 people and all the rooms were full. Despite their work load, all the hotel employers were very nice. Specifically, at the Vela restaurant, Jorge, was always quick, ready with our orders. some tips for the hotel- its location is great, i had a car and it was easy to find and very easy to park- i parked at the 3rd level which is right next to the hotel reception, we walked to seaport village for two nights- it is a very nice walk on the boardwalk in front of the hotel and had dinner there. gaslamp quarter was also a few steps away with the bridge connecting the hotel directly to the quarter. in terms of parking, what i did was i bought the bundle your way package which included parking and breakfast for 25$ a night- otherwise only parking was 27$, so this was a great deal. wi-fi was included in our hotel convention rate, but you could also choose that as part of the bundle your way package. breakfast buffet at the vela restaurant was highly satisfactory, and my daughter was able to get her omelettes done as she liked them- i was also able to hold three business meetings at the restaurant so it was good in terms of saving time. i also used room service and they were prompt, and the food was good. we had lunch/dinner at the fox sports grill-which is below the hotel in front of the promenade, the food was basic american and the atmosphere was very nice. there is also a starbucks and yogurt place on site which we did not use, in addition the pool area and the spa seemed perfect but we did not have time to use those facilities either. it was however very nice to sit outside in front of the fox grill with the fireplace and the ocean behind you. all in all, this is the place to stay in san diego, rooms are perfect with a wonderful view, the staff is delightful and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KellyBayArea
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great! It's a short walk across the bridge to Petco Park and the Gaslamp district. It was easy to get to Sea World and Legoland from here. The hotel itself was nice and clean with comfortable beds and a nice sized bathroom. The only downside was the $27 daily self parking fee and no free in room wi-fi. Although expensive, it was nice having a large parking garage right next to the hotel. My hubby and 3 year old took advantage of the pool everyday and our daughter enjoyed making crafts as well (nice service they provide for free for those with little ones). Also, beware that parking in the garage gets tough on days that the Padres are playing cuz they sell parking for $15 on game days. Who wouldn't want to park here when the stadium is right across the street? This was frustrating for us especially since we were hotel guests. I figured that the Hilton would at least reserve a floor or 2 for those staying at the hotel so that we aren't driving up and down trying to find a spot. Overall, was happy with the stay and would definitely come back on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed150
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for a conference in the hotel. Room was large, spotless and comfortable, as was the hotel as a whole. Service was excellent, hotel bar and restaurants consistently great. Excellent location - right on the bay, but also very short walk to Gaslamp district. I usually avoid the main conference hotel, but this was wonderful...can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: psprof
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a conference at the hotel. The cost was discounted with the conference and we had free internet for conference attendees. I was on the 15th floor with a room facing the ocean side, which gave a beautiful view of the bay and the boats. The hotel is within a short distance walking to the Gaslamp area and a bit farther from some other shopping past the harbor on the waterfront. I actually walked all the way to Little Italy in about 40 minutes. I really had no problems at the hotel. Check-in and Check out was easy as could be. Just be sure to join hilton honors to get a shorter line.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: topwaterjig
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference in March. Great time, excellent food and staff. Conveniently located to everything. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: JahnayMaryland
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I stayed in a King size bed facing the bayfront and it was amazing. Great view of the bay and surrounding areas/sites. Hotel room was great, comfortable bed, room service was right on point. Hotel has onsite yogurt shop that is a must. I really enjoyed. Was in town for business for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Comfortable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinat168
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in late March, and the experience was wonderful! The standard room was clean and spacious, and the bed was heavenly. I especially appreciate the Peter Thomas Roth toiletries and extra plush towels! Room service was efficient and friendly, and the food was solid. Conveniently located near Gaslamp, about a 5-10 minute walk. Another nice touch: My sister had called a few months before to request that our rooms be close to each other, and when we checked in, our rooms were right next door to each other! In my experience, many hotels simply write this in as a simple "request" and often don't follow through, so I was pleasantly surprised to see that the Hilton took this request seriously. Definitely a great hotel for business travelers and families. For younger couples and/or friends, the Hard Rock Hotel located nearby looked pretty nice too, but the Hilton would be a great option as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, even for locals!”
Reviews.Author: onegaucho
Reviews.Content: Used up some Hilton points to book a staycation getaway for my wife and I. Booked a king room with a corner view. I believe if you are in the lower numbers (last 2 digits below 30) and the room number is ODD, then you will have a better view - a view of the bay and parts of the city. If you have an even number, then I believe you have more of a view of the bridge and unfortunately, the docks to the south of the hotel. If you get one of the corner rooms like we did (01-04) then it doesn't really matter. The hotel is only 3 yrs old so most of the decor is very new and clean. Hotel staff is very friendly from the valets to the front desk to the bellhops. The pool is heated and there's a small jacuzzi you can use as well. Starbucks and a yogurt dessert place are downstairs. The gaslamp, Petco, convention center are all within walking distance so you can simply park and walk. Parking is a mandatory $27 per day (until 4pm the following day). Beds were super comfortable as most higher end Hiltons are. We could hear a baby crying in the room next to ours but it wasn't too loud.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: sanibeltravler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this Hilton. I had seen on their website that they had shuttle service and called a week prior to confirm. I was told to just call when I arrive and they would send over the shuttle as it was close to airport. When I arrived, I called and was told there was no shuttle. While that is not insurmountable, it was not expected that I did not have transportation. I did find a reasonable shuttle that I paid for and got there fine. Check-in was fast. Room was typical of a downtown Hilton, upscale bedding. Thankfully, my package included internet as I usually have to pay from $10 per day and up depending upon location. I did see reviews where guests had to pay. View was great looking out over the water and bridge to Coronodo. Housekeeping was attentive. There were several restaurants and a Starbucks in the hotel. I was disappointed to have to pay $18 for a cup soup, salad, iced tea in the sports bar for lunch. Food was fine. We ate there another evening and just got burgers. It was a great location with a waterfront walk for quite some distance to other restaurants, Seaport Village, USS Midway, and ferry tours. I also was able to walk to Gas Light Village with lots of other restaurants, etc. Great trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite San Diego Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: allierskine
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I absolutely LOVE this hotel. This is the second time we've stayed here. It was a little more then I usually pay for hotels- but so worth it! The hotel is beautiful- there is a view from every room. The first time we stayed we got a room with the Bay/City view. This trip, however, we had the Port/Coronado view. While Coronado island is beautiful- I'd suggest the Bay/City view. The rooms are fabulous. Plenty of room to spread out. The beds are AMAZING! So lovely to fall into one at the end of a long day. I love love love the pillows! The bathroom has lots of counter space. Only issue I encountered... I flooded the bathroom floor with water from the shower once. But, its not the hotels fault- I'm just a dork. The best part about this hotel is the location! Its right on the bay. A 5 min walk to the convention center- there is a trolley station right across the street- and just past that is the entrance to the Gaslamp District. It is SO nice to be able to walk to the Gaslamp for dinner or drinks and not have to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfu Experience!”
Reviews.Author: C D
Reviews.Content: After leaving the Hotel del Coronado, we arrived at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront and they immediately upgraded our room to a veranda/bay view and were smiling and ready to help us! They made sugestions and kept asking us how our room was and how our food tasted! It was a dream after a horrible week on Coronado Island. The hotel restaurant had the best food in the world! My Husband asked the cehf to cook him whatever he thught was best because he was so used to being disappointed at Hotel del Coronado- and the chef did NOT let us down!! We ate there twice a day , sometimes and were so happy and relaxed. The rooms were perfectly quiet, But again- the staff made all the difference- They smiled at us and constantly called our room and asked us how they could help. Gotta LOVE a Hilton after a bad experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Views, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: european101
Reviews.Content: Did not 'upgrade' for $20, but still had a room with view over railroad yards and bay. Had requested no feathers due to allergies and they had thoughtfully put an air cleaner in the room. Apart from that, typical Hilton, no charm, but efficient. Walk to Gaslight district not too bad, but if you want to be close to restaurants etc, there are better choices

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: travelbee500
Reviews.Content: We were more than pleased, we were impressed. The hotel was very clean, modern, and comfortable. The service was excellent for diamond members and our room had an amazing view. There were a lot of restaurant choices in the hotel and the location was great. You can walk to many different places downtown. My only regret was that we weren't able to stay longer. Love San Diego and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: MikeUK4
Reviews.Content: Fast check-in to then to wait hours for a room; we were not alone...the main lobby, eating areas and Promenade lobby full of people and bags waiting for rooms to become available. The whole experience of the stay was underwhelming and felt very expensive. We left a day early.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with conference facilities.”
Reviews.Author: DenverD0c
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a conference sponsored by the UCSD Medical School and loved it. Very comfortable room and facilities (including a Starbucks) and friendly, professional and helpful staff. The lobby bar is a very nice place to hang out, and our bartender Brett took very good care of us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: scottBrigham_UT
Reviews.Content: If you want a beautiful treat stay at the new Hilton in San Diego on the Bay. The view from the room is spectacular. The large windows from floor to ceiling and spacious room offer all that would be expected in this beautiful location. I stayed the weekend and loved the stay. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were soft and cuddley. I liked the location, close to the gaslamp district and also there is a beautiful bridge that spans as a walkway between the hotel and Petco Park. What a fantastic place to stay if you want to take in a game also. You can be in your hotel room in less time than to get to your parked car! The bathroom was modern and clean. The hotel is also a great location if you have a conference as the convention center is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good beds, great location, lovely view, expensive parking and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: drneideffer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three days and nights for a conference I was attending. The hotel is quite nice and the rooms are good sized and comfortable. I consider the parking a bit expensive - $27.00 to self-park and $36.00 for valet. You really have no other options for parking your car unless you want a long walk. The view from our room was fantastic and the beds were good. No fridge or mini-bar in the room. No Wi-Fi in the room unless you purchase it at the rate of about $13.00 per day. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby area. Bar seems expensive - A Corona is $8.00. The hotel also operates a Fox sports bar adjacent to the hotel and prices are considerably less there. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Gas Lamp district and the bayfront boardwalk. The boardwalk will take you all the way to Seaport Village and beyond. Staff was friendly and helpful. All-in-all, not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, comfortable conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvrgirlToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a conference. I found out this enormous hotel is new, only 3 years old. The rooms and bathrooms are modern, immaculate and bright with floor to ceiling windows. The beds are extremely comfortable; we slept so well. There was no minibar in the room which was fine for us and there were many places to get food just outside the hotel in the Gaslamp area. There is a Starbucks and yogurt store onsite but they can only be accessed by going outside which is a bit inconvenient. As with previous reviewers' mention, it is a little sterile and impersonal. The lobby is open and there was always people milling about. The concierge was a bit snobby, not even attempting to call one restaurant for a reservation as she was sure it would be fully booked. We used the hottub which was nice. Regarding conference areas, these were plentiful but the wifi access was terrible and not available in the rooms. With conference booking, we got free wifi which was a super perk (they left a message on the phone with the password) and wifi worked seemlessly in the hotel bedrooms, thank goodness. My husband and colleagues were appalled that the waitstaff were clanging dishes and serving etc during a lunch session when speakers were presenting. We hope that the hotel can communicate better with conference organizers to prevent this rudeness by organizing time/breaks when there is no food service and disruption to speakers. The main onsite restaurant Vela was terrible - they messed up our order twice (bringing the wrong dish to our table and then the dish had the wrong side dish) and the total time between sitting down and finally getting our meal was 45 minutes. It was not busy and there was no compensation. I would not eat there unless you absolutely felt lazy and don't want to leave the hotel. Maybe try the Sports Bar. Location is good, right next to the Convention Centre and 5 minutes walk to Petco Park and 5th Ave/Gaslamp Area. Horton Plaza shopping was disappointing. We had dinner at the Hotel Del Coronado one night. It's worth visiting that historic hotel across the Coronado bridge. There is some strange thing about which kind of taxis and can you between San Diego and Coronado though. Nobu in the Hard Rock Hotel across the street was excellent. I was also displeased to find out that packages I sent to this hotel required at least a $6 fee per package for handling as all their mail is processed through the UPS store. No other hotels at which I've stayed had this policy but I think because this hotel is so large, it requires this service. You can check-in for your flight and print your boarding pass for free in the UPS Store/Business Centre. I still give this hotel a 5 points because it was comfortable and new. We paid conference price for this hotel, which was still about $250 per night. I would only consider it again if it was quite discounted. We did however, make good use of Hilton HHonor's current bonus points deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for conference - great location.”
Reviews.Author: travel76bug
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a conference. Great location - easy to access I-5 and Gaslamp District, etc. There are restaurants on site, Starbucks within walking distance, as well as other great restaurants to visit along the pier. However, the internet is NOT great - and the Wifi is less than stellar. The staff was friendly and the valet knew much better, shorter routes than the concierge did. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Would stay again, but mostly for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: ecallaghan
Reviews.Content: We went here for a conference and as a venue for conferences it was ok aside from the shoddy WIFI and the overcharging per device for internet. The hotel was a great location and easy to get into the Gaslight district. Food and drinks at the hotel were to be expected. Very good facilities and rooms, and great views. The area is clean and safe. FOX Grill was a nice place to hang out especially during happy hour. Nice pool outside but feels like an after thought.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, and very convenient for convention center.”
Reviews.Author: dahlheim
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Very nice rooms. Convenient to get in/out, and very convenient for the convention center. This is the nicest part of town imho. Outdoor heated pool and spa. Expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: glenn m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a conference. Very good facilities and rooms, and great views. The area is clean and safe but also feels a little sterile. Not too far to get to the Gaslight district though, where any unrequired sterility is soon gone....

Reviews.Title: “The Best We've Tried for Convention Center, Petco Park or Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: solomentehawaii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at several of the downtown San Diego properties and this is our favorite to date. Pros: 1. Rooms, clean, modern with comfy beds, good down-style pillows, and a large window with pseudo seat to take in the view. 2. Location, PERFECT for a convention,and a bridge to Petco park, right on the bay with fantastic views of Coronado island, a walkway along the waterway connecting you to the convention center, marriott, hyatt, sea port village, and eventually USS midway if you are a GREAT walker. However, only on site restaurants are there, everything else is a bit of a walk. 3. Pool, nice heated pool and jacuzzi with view of the bay (and a large Dole Freighter while we were there) and a Huge TV playing the NCAA basketball tournament. 4. Noise, this is the kicker, some of the other hotels are really near the trolly or worse train, that blows its horn throughout the night. I didn't hear much of anything from my room except some howling wind, but we were in the midst of a heavy winter storm. 5. Views, the lobby bar and various other vantage points have really pretty views of the bay, and had the weather been nicer we would have enjoyed our drink on the deck. They even have a fire ring outside that looked like a fun place to enjoy a drink. Cons: 1. Parking, was $27, I think, my frugal husband did free street parking blocks away, not sure how he found that but he was determined. 2. Service, we only interacted with the staff at check-in and check-out: check-in was luke warm and check-out was really slow due to a couple of guests with prolonged transactions Tips: 1. We bought the bed and breakfast package for an extra $30/nt for 2 buffet passes because I read on Tripadvisor the cash price is like $24? for one so I thought we'd just commit ahead of time. 2. Made a reservation for breakfast buffet, which was great because we caught a huge line from the conventioneers and were able to buypass the line.

Reviews.Title: “Location you can't beat”
Reviews.Author: flowerbelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bay-front San Diego for two days. As we were there for a celebration they upgraded us to an bay facing room which was great except it did not have a bathtub in the bathroom. The hotel is beautiful and large with conference levels and a running/walking path that goes all along the bay. As Hitlon honors Gold we were provided with free access to the spa facilities and a 25 dollar credit to a treatment. The spa has a lounge area with refreshments and an eucalyptus steam room . We spent quite some time enjoying the facilities every day. We also got free appetizers at the Hotel bar which consisted of a handful of chips and some olives. Don't bother using these, you end up paying too much for a drink that you of course need to wash away the salty olives! Service was okay, the staff were helpful and gave us directions whenever we needed it. In fact the doormen and maids were the nicest, the girls are the desk not so much. Parking is extremely expensive at 25 dollars per day but we were okay with that as we got our room for $120 per night. Usually with Hilton gold breakfast is included but instead they give you a voucher for a drink and food item at the starbucks which is attached. You could trade the voucher in and pay an extra $10 for the breakfast buffet which is no way was worth the $35 they were charging. It had a sad looking omelet bar and not enough variety. In addition service was slow. The key advantage of the Hotel is its location to the Gaslamp district which was a half a mile away as well as the stadium. It is also less than 15 minutes from the airport. Overall a good experience. I would stay there but not at the regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great location”
Reviews.Author: deej74
Reviews.Content: Over from the UK for a seminar at the hotel. Very impressed with the service from the moment I arrived. Everything at this hotel has an additional cost. Wi-Fi for example, should be free in a hotel of this calibre. I had a suite - very impressed with it and the view it commanded. Recommed getting out into Gas Lamp district. Great bars (especially the Irish pubs). Hope to be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Vanecita
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for my husband, but myself and my 6 year old daughter joined him. We had a bedroom connected to a hospitality suite. PRO Great location. The hotel is near the gaslight district (walking distance), so plenty of places to go eat for lunch or dinner. If you plan to walk at nighttime I would check with concierge what is the safest way to go, as a friend from San Diego told me downtown can be "spotty" when it comes to safety—meaning that one block could be perfectly OK, then next block is not that safe. If you get a room with a view on Coronado island, bring binoculars. You will see plenty of actions during the day and perhaps catch a glimpse of the Navy Seals returning from their daily practice and of course all sort of military and civilian vessels. The hospitality suite was very nice and very very large. The views were breathtaking, if it wasn't for a large framed print that detached from the wall and almost hit my daughter on the head I will have no complains. If you like jogging or walking you can take a nice stroll all the way down to the shops at the end of the Bayfront (past the convention center). You will walk by the marina and there are a couple of really lovely parks on the water. Beds were comfortable. Loved the Peter Thomas Roth products in the bathrooms! Had a lovely massage at the SPA. They will add 20% gratuity by default, but at least you will be notified prior to receiving the service and you can always adjust the gratuity accordingly. CONS I am going to talk about the "package highjack fee" because it was the first I ever encountered such a thing, and we travel a lot. We had a package shipped to our room. Apparently concierge or the front desk will not hold the package and will send it to the business center instead (which seems to be run by UPS.) You can get your package ONLY if you pay a fee. Of course no one will tell you about that and if you call concierge they may not know about it either. Here's the best part—you would expect a small consistent fee, right? No! the fee is calculated based on the size and weight of the package, so unless you know how much your package weights you'll have no clue until you are trying to redeem it. We had to pay $6.99 for one small package that was probably less than a 1/4 pound. The fee was twice the cost of shipping—the irony! At the business center we were "greeted" by a very rude young woman which had no interest in helping us (Note for management: this person was working on Friday, March 2nd at 6:25PM) . She was slamming envelops on the desk, being very unfriendly and completely annoyed by our presence. When we asked if she could please open the package, she ran the xacto knife so close to my husband hands we thought she was going to cut him! Service at the business center was despicable—and I am still wondering what that fee covers and what if I do not want to pay the fee?...I don't get my package? Some of the cleaning ladies, were sort of...obnoxious and not very discreet. For example they would enter the room without too much notice or without announcing themselves and one in particular, if she saw us in the hallway, she would ask "Does your room need cleaning today?". I think that was the first time ever I was asked that question in a hotel! There are two restaurants in the hotel, but the menus are very limited and fairly boring. They also seem to have problems understanding the difference between "rare" and "medium rare". Children six and under seems to eat free at the breakfast buffet, but some waiters will omit the information... The bedroom itself was very small and average. Inquire about the cost of WIFI as they seem to charge per device and at $13 per day, with multiple laptops, ipads, iphones etc it can get pricey. SPA: it would be a good idea if the cleaning crew does not have to walk through the relaxation area with dirty towels etc—perhaps an alternate route that does not involve passing through the relaxation area? They should also avoid cleaning (dusting in my case) the relaxation area while guests are in there. TIPS The San Diego Zoo is a must-see, but take a trip to La Jolla (bring plenty of quarters for parking). Our daughter enjoyed exploring the tidal pools and probably had more fun there she had at the Zoo. Check online for the best time of the day to go explore the pools. For lunch go to Georges. Great food and location. It can get a bit crazy there, so expect to wait one hour for a table. Additionally check out La Valencia hotel—A little gem, in Hispanic style! and if you like Dr. Seuss stop by Legends Gallery, Fine Art of La Jolla. Great cupcakes at Sprinkles in La Jolla Village (there's also a Whole Foods there).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton in all of the USA!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bessdressed
Reviews.Content: Hands down the absolutely BEST Hilton in all the country! From the first day my husband and I have stayed here, we have been welcomed as family! Even as the busy hotel they are, they always make us feel special and at home! We have come to know a few of the employees as "friends" and make it a point to see them all every time we check in. First off, the face who always welcomes us as the front desk is Jorge. Always makes it a point to make sure our stay is the most enjoyable it can be! Even if he is isn't the one checking us in, he will call up to our room to make sure check in went well! Secondly, we look forward to waking up in the morning only to see our favorite hostess at the Vela restaurant to greet us with her inviting smile- Miss Melanie! Not only to us, but she is so welcoming making your morning that much better. But it doesn't stop there, the master chef behind the omelet station Miguel is so friendly and passionate about what he does-cooking delicious food (his gravy is to die for and the blueberry pudding.....MmmmMmmm!! Lastly, many stops to the Starbucks on the ground floor has given us a chance to get to know Tony- the best barista EVER! He always remembers us and goes above and beyond what we need or even ask for! Whenever we have a choice where we stay in San Diego, I don't need to convince my husband that this hotel has met and exceeded every expectation I have! The PEOPLE make our choice simple. Thank you for letting us join your family as you've become a part of ours, stay after stay! Perks for Diamond members have been OUTSTANDING! Wouldn't ask for anything more- they think of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: VTtravelbug17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the Hilton Bayfront and anticipating the run of the mill conference center I was happily surprised. From the check in to check out customer service was their priority. Both the room and bathroom were large, clean and mine had a beautiful view. The food in both restaurants was good, plentiful and tasty (although The Vela was more expensive). The Fox Sports Grill had good food (less expensive) and fun atmosphere. I liked the location, right on the water with a great boardwalk which took you to the Eastport Village in about 10 minutes (lots of shops and restaurants). Downtown Gaslamp Quarter, restaurants and the Westfield shopping plaza were all easy walks. I also think that just being across the road from the Quarter made this location less noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but noisy at times”
Reviews.Author: sshrek
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hilton Bayfront to be as close as possible to the convention center, since I was there for a conference. The hotel is indeed within a few minutes walking distance to the conference center, which is very convenient. The walk to the Gaslamp quarter takes 10-15min, which is fine if your main purpose if the conference anyway. The check-in was swift and the staff friendly. Checking-out, however, took me almost 20min, because only one out of four or five counters was staffed, which was simply not enough to cope with the rush of people wanting to check out at 9:30am. My room on the 25th floor was spacious, very clean and well equipped. In particular the work-desk and the high-end office chair were perfect for getting some work done after-hours. The internet access in this hotel was unfortunately not complimentary; instead one has to pay a minimum of $13.95 per day. There is complimentery WiFi access in the lobby of the hotel, but this does not get mentioned anywhere. The bed and the pillows were fine for me, i.e., I slept well despite having to cope with a 9h time difference. Having said that, I got woken up one night by clanking noises. As it turned out a Dole banana freighter had just arrived and they had started unloading the banana containers onto trucks straight away. Once they had unloaded the ship, they loaded it with empty containers, which turned out to be even noisier. The entire process continued for the next three days & nights, which was a bit annoying, but I suppose there is nothing the hotel can do about it. Still, I enjoyed staying at this hotel very much and would recommend it. It might just be better to get a room towards the convention center and not out the back of the hotel overlooking the Dole truck depot.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Diego CA Bayfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvToVacation76
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at Hilton San Diego Bayfront Hotel. All in all a good stay. Outside pool facing the bay is nice but no tiki bar like at the Hyatt down the street. You had to go inside to order food at the restrauant. The pool service was closed. Food at the restraunts was good. Fox Sports Bar and Grill was a nice place. Outisde were several seating areas with a gas firepit which we sat by every night. This faced the bay. No coffee service in the hotel you had to go outside the hotel and enter Starbucks and Fox Sports Grill from the outside so we thought that was not convenient. There was also a frozen yogurt store you had to enter from the outside. The room was nice and big but the beds were soft. The bathtub was a regular porcelain tub with a shower curtain. I thought maybe it would be a little more fancy. I thought it was a hotel made for business people who may attend the convention center next door. Not fancy and no extra perks like the Hyatt but I do not know the rates of the Hyatt either.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: UpstateHokie
Reviews.Content: Check in- Smooth and they actually allowed us to check into our room at 11am, well before the traditional 3pm mark. Amenities - Great. We've enjoyed the FOX Sports Bar and Grill on site several times over the course of our stay along with Starbucks. Free Wi-Fi with our status as conference attendees, great perk. Pool- Great view of the bay and very family friendly. View- Awesome view of the bay. For those of you who can't handle that you’re staying adjacent to a working port, yes with actually Dole container ships than opt for the city view; however, you'll be missing out on a great view of the bay if you do this. Room- Modern and clean. I was skeptical according to other tripadvisor reviews that the room would be small. I'm happy to report I'm very satisfied with the size and layout of our accommodations. Gaslamp Access - Convenient pedestrian bridge leads you directly from the hotel to Petco Park and the Gaslamp District with plenty of shopping and tons of great eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: gldnpupper27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for a business meeting in early March. When checking in, we were upgraded to a higher room with a king bed. Everly helped us at the front desk and could not have been more helpful. The room was on the 29th floor with an incredible view of downtown and Seaport Village. The room was incredibly clean and the housekeeping staff did a fantasic job each day keeping the room tip top for us. This hotel also has a very nice pool and jacuzzi area....when it is warm enough to use it. But even if you want to just enjoy the sun, the hotel has a plexiglass barrier to cut the wind down around the pool. We did not eat at the restaurant, but we did enjoy the bar. Downstairs you also have Fox Sports and Starbucks and a sweet shop. The parking is right next door and it is easy to get from the garage to the hotel from the third floor. There is also a walkway that goes over Harbor Drive, so you can safely walk to the Gaslight District. The hotel does not have much greenery around it, which is the only thing I would change about it....but it makes up for it in all other areas. Great place to stay when in downtown San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: XanderJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent because the rooms are clean and fancy. The pool is very clean. There are two pools: a regular pool and a jacuzzi. The hotel is near a train station (I really like trains). The value is pretty good. The atmosphere is great. The service is very nice. You could see the city and the water from our room. The hotel's restaurant's calamari is so good. The sleep quality is just excellent. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: captew
Reviews.Content: nice upgraded room on the 29th floor overlooking the bay and the baseball stadium. Was here for a tradeshow at the convention center. Short walk and nicer hotel than old Marriot next door. Great buffett breakfast, good Fox Sports bar for inside or outside. Very friendly staff. Nice outdoor pool and jacuzzi. Was just under $200/nite but worth it. Nice job Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, nice folks”
Reviews.Author: Member3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and thought that the Hilton was very good. I had a 17th floor room overlooking the bay. It was a beautiful view. The staff were professional, friendly, and outgoing. From check-in to Housekeeping to the Hilton people who staff the Starbucks, all were consistently helpful and friendly. The room was large and clean. The only "dings" I'd give it are (1) the tub plug was stuck in the down position and the handle of the plug had broken off. I kept the water flowing by jamming a pen under the plug. One call to the front desk and the problem was fixed, (2) no laundry bag in the room. Again, one note to Housekeeping and they left two, and (3) no executive lounge. For Hilton Honors gold members, they gave coupons for the Starbucks and for a "tasting plate" at the bar/lounge. I didn't try the tasting plate but enjoyed the Starbucks coupons (any food and any beverage item). If you're looking for an inexpensive, casual meal, The Tin Fish across the street next to the Omni hotel is very good. A cod fish taco and side of coleslaw cost less than $5 and was enough for dinner. The coleslaw is vinegar-based which makes it refreshing. The hotel is approximately 15 minutes from the airport and immediately adjacent to the convention center. I'd stay here again for the beautiful views and nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: 007whenderson
Reviews.Content: Everytime I fly into & out of San Diego I stay at this hotel, free shuttle, takes you around to malls etc.. and comfortable beds for a great night sleep. Beautful Harbour, very clean Hotel. Restaurant is excellent, I have stayed here 5 times and have never been dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well managed”
Reviews.Author: Billartrip
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel...rooms fresh. The parking continues to be the only negative..too expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MS03t1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location. Could walk to Seaport Village, and Gaslamp district which are full of shops and restaurants (and great night life). Hotel is on the bay which provided terrific view of boats, yachts etc. The hotel was clean, had bar and restaurant, but the best feature is the outdoor seating, fire bowl and heaters. We sat outside every night and enjoyed drinks by the fire.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: WendaK
Reviews.Content: Out date of stay was Dec. 23, 2011. We arrived late (or early) at 1:30 am and our room was ready. Check in was quick. Bedroom was lovely with such nice amenities in the bathroom. We used the dining room for breakfast ... a bit too expensive but very nice and pleasant view of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LUCAS T
Reviews.Content: if you don´t mind to pay a little bit more than average, and you like modern, good located hotels, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Beautiful hotel, great location and unbelievable views.”
Reviews.Author: JVBV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new and beautifully designed. It is at the south end of the Convention Center, so an excellent choice if you're in the area for a meeting there. A couple block walk will put you in the center of the Gaslamp District with all restaurants and things to do there. I was lucky enough to get a room high up with beautiful views of the bay. Although I spent most of my exercising time outside (the bayfront trail is right beside the hotel), the exercise facility is large with a good variety of well maintained machines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lovemy02Boys
Reviews.Content: Our family of four recently stayed here while my husband attended a business conference. Having just come from a hotel in Carlsbad, our room (Port/Coronado view) seemed very small in comparison. We were pleased to be placed in a room on the top floor and enjoyed the view of the Coronado Bridge. I would like to point out that the "Port" view is rather unsightly, and is actually a view of the Dole trailers below. It might be worth the extra cost to upgrade your room to a include an alternate view. We enjoyed the location, and the walk over the bridge in the evenings to the Gaslamp District. We valet parked the first two nights, then opted for self-parking the last three nights. We went to the breakfast buffet for two mornings of our stay, and as much as we wanted to enjoy it, we did not. The fruit selections seemed rather tasteless, and the bread/pastry selection was dry each morning. Bacon was limp and undercooked. Overall, very disappointing for $24 per person. We also tried the Fox Sports Grill. Beer selection was good, however, the food we ordered was average at best. My children enjoyed the Sweet Things yogurt shoppe near the Starbucks. We did enjoy the proximity to the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Common Areas, Average room”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two days and one night for a conference. The lobby and common areas of the hotel are beautiful and modern. The location is right on the bay within easy walking distance of the Gaslamp District. Check-in was easy and the staff were very friendly and professional. The rest of the staff I encountered were also very friendly and accommodating. We were provided breakfast and lunch because of the conference and although the food was gorgeously presented, it was sub-par and not very tasty. I know that the hotel had to feed over 600 people at one time which is quite a feat, but the service was choatic and the food was just not very good. The room was a little disappointing because it was small and really nothing special. After spending time in the lobby and conference areas, I was expecting a stellar room, but it was just a nicely decorated, average, hotel room. I felt it was very similar to a Holiday Inn Express room. The bed was very comfortable though. One of my coworkers had a corner view room with two large windows. Although her room was just as small, the view made that room much nicer than the one I was in. I would probably stay here again if the price was right. The service couldn't have been better, the common areas were beautiful, and the location is excellent. However, I was disappointed in the food and the room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to Convention Center!”
Reviews.Author: trinisteph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during the CA Democratic Convention (2/10/12 - 2/12/12) and the hotel was pretty much sold out that weekend, with delegates, electeds, staff, and others. The view from the high floor, bayview room is excellent. The service and rooms are what you would expect of a hilton property. Nothing stands out in particular except that its nice Hilton now has the new Peter Thomas Roth amenities in the bathroom, which is a lot better than the previous line of no name products. The restaurants, as others have mentioned are a little overpriced. The Fox Sports Bar which is on the lower level, is pretty decent and packed but closes earlier than expected on the weekends. The lobby bar has last call at 1am, even if its packed, which is surprising. Overall, your best bet is to explore restaurants in other parts of downtown San Diego, and if its outside the gaslamp quarter, you can always share a cab. The hotel website and some tripadvisor reviews are misleading. The hotel is close to the gaslamp quarter but be aware it is a hike, especially if you're short on time. You need to calculate at least 15min each way unless you plan on jogging across the bridge and over to the heart of the gaslamp quarter. Some folks I know would just cab it over (approx $5), especially if time is a factor and/or if you have challenges walking distances. The hotel is a brisk 10 min walk to the convention center and there were shuttles to/from the hotel, during the convention, which ran infrquently, since this tends to be one of the closest hotels. Overall, it's a nice hotel, good customer service and a convenient location. It's also a quick 10min. cab ride from the downtown Amtrak station, which is a nice alternative if you don't want to drive from the LA area. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Not as fantastic as it is made out to be...”
Reviews.Author: LillyMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel two weeks ago for a conference. The location of the hotel is somewhat misleading. While the view of the bay and mountains is gorgeous, the walking distance to the Gaslamp distance is actually quite a hike across hilly streets. I found this out the hardway when I asked for directions for the concierge desk and was given either out right wrong information or misleading information. As far as the hotel stay went, it was just okay. I appreciated that the rooms were very quiet and there was plenty of counterspace. I would recommend an upgrade to a bayview room. Now, the problems... The second day I tryed to use the iron in my room. It either had not been cleaned or the previous user added a fluid to it other than water. So, when I started to iron my pants, the iron leaked out the fluid and stained it. I called the conceirge desk and they offered to send up a replacement iron, but said nothing about the pants. When the maintenance man arrived, I told him that they should pay for the pants to be cleaned since it wasn't my fault that the iron was broken. He agreed and told me that I get the pants back in the afternoon. When I checked into my room later, the pants were there with a note that the cost of the cleaning would not be charged to me. When I checked out a few days later, the cost of the dry cleaning was charged to me anyway, in addition to the entire cost of the trip, which had been pre-paid by my company. I explained this to the desk clerk, who was very rude and incompetent. Flustered by the conversation, I left my coat before getting into the cab. Once I got to the airport, I realized I was missing it, so I called back to the hotel. Hours later, they called me to say they found the coat and would send it UPS Ground. On the whole, these problems could have been overlooked, except for the fact the hotel staff were so uncaring after each point of interaction. If I travel back to San Diego, I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Good Service - Food Prices high though”
Reviews.Author: voetbal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel not really knowing what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised by the location when we arrived - nice ocean view - boardwalk to Seaport Village and an easy 10 minute walk to the gaslamp area. We had a room which included breakfast which was a huge perk because the buffet breakfast was phenomenal! Scones and pastries, hot made to order omelettes, smoked salmon, you name it. Awesome! The people in the restaurant were very friendly and helpful, even when our 5 year old barfed all over the carpet one morning at breakfast. They sent help, asked if we needed a doctor, etc. The concierge was also helpful. The only thing I would say is that the food in general at the hotel was pricey for lunch/dinner/room service. I also was charged $3.99 for a pack of gum in the hotel store. The pool was heated and felt great. Didn't partake in any spa activities as we were with our kids. Rented a car for a day from Enterprise which was also super convenient. The car was ready for us in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geeseland
Reviews.Content: I have Diamond status so I might be a little skewed on this hotel. That being said it was an excellent place to stay with great views and close walking distance to Gas Lamp and many other great restaurants. I highly recommend it if you are looking for a well staffed convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, plenty to do.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley D
Reviews.Content: Great view from my room. Very spacious, tons to do in the hotel alone, right on the water and close to Gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Seal by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: lionesslight
Reviews.Content: I had a corner "Room with a View". My last morning there a seal was sun bathing on his back, floating by the side of the hotel right below my room. Hotel services were incredible. I did valet park, but there is a parking ramp literally attached to the hotel... I'd choose that option if I stay there again. I did eat at the sports bar there, the service was VERY SLOW! I was asked to move from the 4 person table I was at to a different 4 person table in the corner so a "party of 6" people could sit there after I had already waited 15 minutes before they came. They took their order before mine, served them before even taking my order. I would not eat there again and the food was subpar at best. Back to the hotel. Very peaceful and quiet rooms. It is also directly across the street from the convention center and the Gas Lamp Quarters. I really enjoyed my stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Typical convention Hilton Hotel - does not "support the troops" out of price range if in military.”
Reviews.Author: Sag_Mom
Reviews.Content: As always, Hilton does a good job with clean spacious rooms and this was no exception. The rooms are quiet and have lots of amenities one expects with a room that goes for over $200/night. We were there for a convention; however, we are military and thus could not book at the convention rate which included the free internet. So, we paid the government rate (which would be reimbursed); however, they did not want to give us the internet which was included for all other convention goers because our room was less then theirs. Well, the REASON the military gets a lower rate is because it pays the bills with TAX PAYER dollars, it also means that those SERVING in the military don't make as much as their counterparts making it more difficult to afford $15/day internet fees. Had to go all the way to the manager of the hotel to finally get the internet charge removed. Maybe that is ridiculous to everyone else, but it was a stretch for our budget since the military budget has been cut and so have pay raises, and very limited reimbursement. No more cabs allowed only shuttles, no internet reimbursed, meals are on a per diem basis not a check, so even eating breakfast at the hotel was more than the days per diem. This is not a hotel that supports the troops.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Hilton”
Reviews.Author: cuspdoc
Reviews.Content: Maybe just a little above average. Good view of the Bay. Get a corner King. The website does not advertise a spa, but there is a very nice spa on location.

Reviews.Title: “All was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Stepbouc
Reviews.Content: Wow wow wow!!!! Best location for meeting near of thé convention center , near of the 5th street

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RLMartin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while helping with a conference at this location. The hotel itself is an architectural masterpiece with lots of art displayed and well designed overall. I had a room on the 20th floor facing north with an incredible view of the city and the bay. I would request to be on the north side of the building. The other side probably isn't bad, but its of shipping piers and truck parking. Its a short walk down the bay walk to Seaport Village and a short walk to the 5th Avenue Gaslamp district. Its also close to Petco field and next door to the convention center. There's a nice sports bar in the lower level, Fox Sports Grill and a Starbucks. Overall a great hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center Blues”
Reviews.Author: Rick_and_Carol
Reviews.Content: Hotel has very good rooms, staff was polite, friendly, & helpful. So flying in & discover hotel this big has no dedicated shuttle service. There for a convention and the hotel has a "pay for use wireless". Thankfully some convention attendees set up hot spots through-out the hotel. Come on Hilton you have to charge for wireless? My last stay in San Diego was at the Catamaran Resort on Mission Bay, free wireless. I know the wireless fee was probably minimal and is a trivial thing but my next outing to San Diego will be at the Catamaran. If you're there for a convention or ball game this hotel's advantage is it's close proximity to both

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but staff stiff!”
Reviews.Author: sharbe
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bayfront is beautiful! Great location on waterfront with views of Coronado Bridge and marinas. A bit of a walk from Gaslamp District, but directly across from Petco Park. The room was typical for a good hotel, but staff was just "doing their job". No one went out of their way to make us feel welcome, give us any extra information or travel advice. No one offered extra towels, umbrellas (yes, it actually poured the day we were there!!). Concierge was curt, answered our question by pulling out a map and circling a location--no advice, no conversation, no extra help. This is not acceptable in a 4 star hotel!!! There are so many great hotels in San Diego that I would choose another one before I stayed here again. Disappointing because they have a beautiful location and building. Staff needs to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Modern with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: glamtrav
Reviews.Content: Situated at the lower end of the Bay front…this hotel is very modern and has plenty of facilities on site to keep you from being bored. It is located directly next to the convention center and across the street from Petco Park and the Gas lamp District. Rooms are very new and modern. The staff is very helpful and attentive and they ensure that you are happy. No free wi-fi unless you are Hilton Gold and above, but the Starbucks or Fox Grill offers it free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view of bay and downtown”
Reviews.Author: arun0708
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two kids for 4 nights. Absolutely fantastic view of bay/downtown/gas lamp quarter. We stayed in a higher floor, we could see the harbor, USS midway, downtown buildings and gas lamp quarter. It is few minutes walking distance to gas lamp quarter. Great location for many attractions. The pool and hot tub are nice, situated right next to harbor. The restaurants inside are quite expensive, so I recommend walking out to gas lamp quarter/downtown which has all sort of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: Rainzee
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean, but only average size and amenities also average. What made our room was the breathtaking view of the water provided by our window on the 27th floor facing the water. Well worth the upgrade to have this every morning and evening. The location was also excellent for its proximity to the great restaurants and sights. My husband was attending a conference in the hotel and I had no problem occupying my time with walking to everything I needed!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Bayfront”
Reviews.Author: ktc3tls5
Reviews.Content: This our first stay and we were very pleased and impressed with the service on all levels. The Vela Restaurant, though a somewhat limited menu, was outstanding, service impeccable, and food was cooked and presented to perfection. The flatiron steak was juicy, tender, and correctly cooked. The eggplant curry had a nice bite of spicyness and absolutely mouth watering. A must try on the dessert menu was the crem brule trio......three small portions to share; mango, rasberry chocolate, and blackberry. We repeated the following night. The room was clean and well kept, though we were disappointed that the king rooms all came with a chaise lounge......made it hard for two to sit and relax............and, no towel bars but hooks. I guess that turned out all right, but towels dry more quickly on bars. Other than that. the view was spectacular and walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter..........though one could pass that up. A mixture of unkempt buildings and restaurant/bars.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek”
Reviews.Author: MSelmi
Reviews.Content: This is a new Hilton, so the scars from the conventioneers and screaming kids have yet to materialize - It's still in resort shape. If you care about the view, then it's worth the extra script to upgrade to the bay views, which are impressive. The view of the railroad yard from the other side of the hotel is considerably less inspiring, unless you really like railroad track. The photos are an accurate depiction of the hotel. It's sleek, with contemporary modern public spaces. The location is not as central as the Marriott, but not by much. The hotel is located on the other side of the convention center, so it's right on the water but a bit outside of reasonable walking distance to the Gaslamp district or Petco. Valet is 30 bucks a day, but there is also public parking. It might be wise to check to see if there is a convention in town during the dates of your stay, as the experience can vary depending upon occupancy levels. The room is well done. Hilton has great beds in their newer hotels and this is no exception. The service is nothing exceptional, but the hotel is a good value - A bit newer and more contemporary than The Grand Hyatt or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler811
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while on vacation. This hotel was very sleek and modern. The views of the bay were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Hiton again”
Reviews.Author: dleslievol
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for a couple of nights on a business trip. This is the fist time at this hotel and the first time at a Hilton hotel in quite a while. I have to say I was impressed with this property. I remember the Hilton brand going downhill a few years back, but this hotel is really nice. A few negatives...if you are on the side facing the Dole Bananna facility, it is not a great view. I got to watch a REAL Banana boat being unloaded and loaded and truck constantly zooming all around the facility. I was on the 22nd floor so the noise was not a problem but the view was not spectacular. Others I spoke to had a much better view so ask for a room with a view of the Bayfront, towards the other hotels. The WiFi was the slowest of any hotel I have been to in along time...my Netflix would not load at all because it was so slow...good for slowly checking email was about the only use for it. Breakfast buffet was so packed I gave up on trying to get in...the service there was very slow. I would suggest picking either real early or a letter breakfast time to get right in. Positives...super clean room. Everything was perfect, no hairs in the shower! Big, fluffy towels to dry off with after the shower. The water warmed quickly and lasted! Really close to the Convention Center and a great sky bridge over the main street and streetcar tracks right into the heart of the city for baseball or the Gaslamp District or just finding a great place to eat or drink. The elevators have high and low floor banks so you can zip up to your room if you are on any of the higher floors (19 or above)...this is a real convienant feature. The lobby is spacious and clean..the whole hotel is very modern and laid out well. There is a Fox Sports Bar on the bottom floor right next to the Starbucks and the Frozen Yourgurt store. This hotel had just about everything you could want and a great location...I would stay there again if I need to go back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property if your budget allows”
Reviews.Author: JTVohana
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while attending a meeting at the convention center. Very sleek modern hotel, spacious room, nice bed, beautiful view, well equipped for the business traveller. Very pleasant service from the staff. Only one slight disappointment, the don't have a Gold/Diamond Concierge room which seems a bit surprising to me for such a large property with a heavy business clientele. The location is right next to the convention center, parking is ample but expensive ($27/night). Has an excellent sports bar and Starbucks on premises. Room service food was excellent, but very expensive. Gaslamp district restaurants are a 5-15 minute walk. Note of caution to families, not much in the way of cheap eateries nearby. Overall, a wonderful hotel as long as your budget allows.

Reviews.Title: “Bayfront Hilton, the best bay view in town”
Reviews.Author: traveler_n_texas
Reviews.Content: My 1st trip to San Diego, or the West Coast for that matter, and feel like I got picked the right hotel to enjoy it. You can't go wrong with the view, whether you have a preference for city view or Bay view, who cares, it's all gorgeous from the high floors! Exactly what you expect from Hilton high end property, new, clean, service, service, service. The only thing I will say, although I'm a gold Hilton honors member, and I've stayed at enough properties to know better, I do get annoyed at all the nuisance fees. $20 per day for internet, no free wi fi, even the business center charges for internet access, $36 per day for parking, the water. So annoying, the nickle and Dime-ing at a high end hotel.... anyway, once I got past that, I'll say, we were walking from Gaslamp district with lots of great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: kerwin0959
Reviews.Content: Traveled here on business and it was a very nice change of pace. The views of the marina from this hotel are fabulous. Quick walk to the Gaslamp District where there are tons of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Hilton SD Bayfront”
Reviews.Author: Jojeffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on a family trip in January. Our room was on a corner of the 16th floor, with a great view of Petco Park and the Gaslamp area on one side and the port train yards (which the kids loved) on the other. The room was top-notch, and the location was great. It was a breeze getting to/from the Gaslamp area, and the whole family enjoyed being able to walk up the bayfront behind the Convention Center. The fitness center was nice, perhaps a little small, but all the machines looked to be in good condition. We didn't eat or drink in any of the bars or restaurants, so I can't speak to those. I don't recall having any issue with the wifi, I believe it was complementary for us thanks to my wife's work function there.

Reviews.Title: “Internet would give it a higher rating”
Reviews.Author: hardern
Reviews.Content: The beds are comfortable and staff are extremely accommodating. There are options for dinning and while the Starbucks line can be long in the morning, they are quick. I was there for a conference and the location is great for events like that (Gaslamp district, Convention Centre). If you like to run, the bayfront walkway is excellent, and even at 5am, there is lighting (which is a bit dim as you progress) however there are generally so many other people out that early, you never feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed in great location but missed having Internet access”
Reviews.Author: Sharimck
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the Hilton heavenly beds and pillows for a good nights sleep. The interior lobby of this hotel is large, open and airy and it is ideally located right beside the convention centre, connected by a unique pedestrian bridge to Petco Centre and the Gaslamp Quarter, right on the Bay. There are even several geocaches hidden within a five minute stroll! The only downsides....rooms a bit small but view from the 30th floor was beautiful through the large clean window, bathroom was plain but spotless, but I sorely missed having free wifi in the rooms. This is an expensive hotel, and charging a steep fee for basic Internet access is unacceptable. Limit the data use per room if you must, but provide a basic free access so patrons can Skype with their families before bed and check their email. Being a member of the Hilton Honours program doesn't even get you free access except in the lobby area, where you need to enter a complicated numerical code each day you connect. A hotel of this quality needs to provide this as a basic service to all guests. Lose the free newspaper and ice machines to cover the cost of in-room access. Competitive hotels are already there.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton that delivers on it's promise”
Reviews.Author: eye7eye
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in SaN Diego and the hotel is perfectly located next to the convention centre and a short walk from downtown. The breakfast was very well presented and everything was fresh and scrumptious. Unfortunately they don't have a minibar in the room, but bottled water is set out daily. Staff were friendly and the gym is satisfactory. They also have classes outside, so there is no excuse not to burn off those breakfast calories. I enjoyed the ambience in the hotel which is relaxed and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “So far, yet so close.”
Reviews.Author: Stevedusa
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed at the Hilton Bayfront in San Diego. When they say it's bayfront, they are not lying. Location: Like I mentioned, this property is right in front of the bay. Coronado Bridge to the west and the Naval base to the east, then the beautiful and lively downtown San Diego to the south. Getting around the hotel might get a little tricky as the road leads/leaves the hotel is parallel to a very busy set of train tracks. In addition it's right next to the Gaslamp Quarter which is constantly in heavy traffic. However don't let this get you down, as I suggest you WALK or take the public transportation (San Diego Trolley right in front) to wherever your destination is. Many of the close by destinations can keep you busy for a good 24 hours. Let it be family, historic or just some night life, you can pretty much find it around the hotel. Hotel: As many of you mentioned, unlike many Hilton properties in historic towns, this one is a very new hotel. I do not recall when it was built but if you compare to it's sister hotel literally across the street, this is not your typical, San Diego jaded hotels. If upbeat, new and bright is what you are looking for, then this is the hotel for you. The lobby is large, clean and bright. First impression it gave you is a very upbeat and comfortable welcome as you step into the lobby. Many amenities are located close to the lobby and it doesn't take much leg work to find whatever you are looking for. Also I must give credit to the sofas around the lobby right by the giant windows, they are comfortable. With the view of either the bay or the cityscapes, it's a very welcoming treat. Staff / Service: Friendly and professional. I simply don't need any other adjectives to describe them. Prompt, fast, sometimes very funny, treats everybody with their best. Not just the front desk staff, pretty much everybody I came across in the hotel are just well, happy and friendly. Valet is one of the most efficient I've ever seen. Cost a bit much but then again parking in San Diego, especially in downtown area is nothing but a major hassle. The valet is daily-rated so you have in-and-out access. Check in / out are fast. Now here's where the perk comes in... if you are a HHonors member like I do and when you reach certain level, you will realize that it's totally worth being royal and all the perks that comes with it makes the whole stay a new experience. Room / Amenities: I originally booked the corner view room but was offered an eUpgrade standbys. Now you can only get this if you book directly from Hilton. So upon check in, I was offered the Executive Corner Suite, aka the Sea Suite at the north west corner of top floors, at a pretty steep discount. Again you can only get these offers if you book directly from Hilton and being a HHonor member. The room was one of the BEST view rooms I've stayed at in any Hilton properties. Check out the pictures I included below and you will see why. It's large, clean, very modern and best of all, the view. From Coronado Bridge to the entire downtown San Diego, just the view is worth the price. The amenities in the room are very new. Furniture and all the fixtures are kept in good shape, however some of them needs a little maintenance. The bedroom is roomy, the bathroom is even better. Which if you have a standard of what a modern hotel should be equipped with, then this Hilton meets all the standards. One thing I had problem with was the bed. Now I am not sure if it's the mattress itself or what, but it seems like it's broken. The best way I can put it is the mattress I slept on was way too soft/plush without proper support. As if the springs inside has no tension to support any weight. More or less I had a good sleep there. Oh yes you can hear almost no noise at all! Which can be a tricky thing to do when some of the locomotives running at full power slowly passes by the hotel. Overall I would suggest this hotel to those whom wants to see downtown San Diego and the magnificent view of the bay at the same time. I see a lot of business travelers but not a lot of families here. Then again at the time of my visit it's not considered peak time for tourism. Remember this is at one of the prime location of San Diego and the hotel itself is very new. Expect modern facility here and remember, it pays to be a HHonors member.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - mildly substandard amenities/services”
Reviews.Author: BVostmyer
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel during it opening and was quite disappointed so I was apprehensive to stay here again for a conference. The check-in to the hotel was smooth and my initial opinion of the room was positive. The room was average size for San Diego and nicely decorated. Bath was also quite nice. The bed was comfortable and the extra blanket in the room was appreciated. The no so good side were the amenities in the room. The "stylish" and modern trash cans have a tight oval opening and do not accept any type of larger trash. The wash cloths and towels are of extremely poor quality.
