Our room on the 20th floor with an incredible view overlooking the bay was perfect and clean and included such comfortable beds with down comforters. Loved it so.o.o.o much! The views overlooking the BAY are WAY MORE BEAUTIFUL than the views looking at the Coronado bridge. You have a choice of which view you want ... take the BAY and not the bay/bridge. Make a PHONE CALL to book the trip because you can request a HIGH FLOOR which will give you a view you will love, plus you can request EARLY ARRIVAL so you don't have to wait until 3:00 p.m. to check in. We found out WHEN WE ARRIVED that we were booked on the 20th floor...perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & management team were outstanding during "blackout"”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy310
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Thur., Sept 8th thankfully in the afternoon before the blackout. Beautiful room on the 29th floor with a view of Coronado & the city. We had just come back from a walk around downtown & sat at the bar for a drink when the electricity went out. By 5pm there were approx 150-200 guest in & around the bar area. Management came to help Jim the bartender who did a fantastic job under pressure. Before dark the hotel started handing out glow sticks & flashlights to all the guests. It was amazing to see how prepared the hotel was during a crisis. They had so many company conventions in the hotel as well as in the convention center & yet they pulled it off seamlessly. At 7pm they opened up a banquet room and served all guest a cold meal, drinks, dessert and then even though the electric came back on at 1:30am they served a full breakfast buffet in the morning in the ballroom. Eggs, bacon, ham, sausage,muffins, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, you name it and they had it and all complimentary. Can't imagine how much that cost! The next day the bartender said most of the hotel management had stayed until 4:30am to get ready for the following day to make sure everything was in order. On the weekend they were supporting an ArtWalk downstairs & a Triathelon. Sat evening the Minn. Vikings stayed at the hotel before their game with SD. San Diego Hilton Bayfront employees thanks for another wonderful stay. You sure know how to handle the pressure of a lot of different situations. You all do it prefessionally & with class!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-cool suprise by the bay!”
Reviews.Author: OHLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Book a long holiday weekend stay here and what a pleasant surprise it was! It's an ultra-cool, very modern hotel at the quieter end of the Gaslamp district but very close nonetheless. The lobby is unlike most hotel lobbies and the reception folks are super friendly. The decor is very modern with a nice mix of glass and metal. The lobby bar overlooks the bay front where you can enjoy happy hour while watching the sun set...beautiful! The rooms are very well appointed and we were very fortunate have been upgraded to a room with bay front and city views! Again, the sunsets were spectacular. They had wine tastings, accompanied by 'munchies' two of the three evenings we were there and let me tell you, they didn't skimp on either the wine or food! Fries with truffle oil and parmesan + sparkling wine tasting = ultimate decadence!! It was all done on the outdoor portion of the restaurant Vela - another unexpected treat! The pool and surrounding area were nice though it could be roomier. The DJ playing music over the weekend was a bit annoying as the choice of music was perhaps inappropriate (rap and hard rock) considering there were small children present; this is my only negative critique of this facility. The pool staff were more than accommodating though…as were all the staff we encountered. Given the chance, we would jump at a chance to stay here again! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “A solid, tried and trusted place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: RdRnnr23
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this specific Hotel (previously Dec 2009). My wife and I both like this hotel, it has tasteful artwork throughout and the welcome is always warm, each element of the rate or package is meticulously gone over on arrival so if you have any questions they can be resolved straight away. The self parking is very easy and saves over $10 a night but if you don't care, the valet is very quick and professional at $36 plus tip. The rooms were clean and very nicely done out, super Shower and the bed is just dreamy. The hotel is perfectly located for driving out to Coronado or leaving the car parked and walking into Gaslamp or along the front to Seaport Village. There are trolleys and other transport if you want to go further afield. A chat with the concierge will set you up nicely to do whatever or go wherever you want, the Zoo, SeaWorld or Balboa Park all fairly close. The one thing San Diego can't seem to do consistently (which on our 7 or 8 visits now still surprises us) and that is good food. Sure there are some really good places but the number of bad ones particularly in the Gaslamp is quite depressing. Consistency, repeatability and reliability is the main enemy here ... what might be ok one meal is completely rubbish the next! A few exceptions ... The Fish Market (between Seaport and USS Medway) ... very nice, superbly fresh fish and a very warm welcome (even when very busy); The Brigantine (Coronado) and the Hotel's own Vela a great classical but at the same time contemporary mix. The Hotel has 2 others available - the Fox Grill (any port in a storm) but not a lot of care put into the cooking, though corrected promptly once pointed out (on 2 separate occasions) and Odysea ... just avoid would be my recommendation. All in all we really like this Hotel and location and is certainly in the mix when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “an OK hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: BostonwalkerBoston
Reviews.Content: it is a decent Hilton hotel, but maily for business people. If you have family, the room is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Allergen-free room is great”
Reviews.Author: RenZhe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to the San Diego Convention Centre and within very walkable distance. What impressed me was the impeccable reception service. They served me very efficiently, and most importantly, also in a very friendly manner. The room I had was very fresh and true to what the hotel claimed - it was allergen-free! I did not know how they did it - I did not develop any usual allergic reactions such as runny nose - as I usually had due to my chronic rhinitis. The only downside was my room was facing the Dole container yard. I did not have the luxury of paying an extra USD20 to upgrade to a sea facing room. Anyway, it was great staying there during my conference at the Convention Cetnre.

Reviews.Title: “Love San Diego, Blackout or No Blackout!”
Reviews.Author: JenKlu2
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how well everyone at Hilton Bay Front responded to a very lengthy power outage. My husband and I were staying at the Hilton, while he attended a large conference I was there to enjoy my time. I fell in love with San Diego and the Hilton made me love it even more! With a full hotel, with not only guests, but people attending the many conferences, every team member and Management did an excellent job helping everyone out. Thank you for the free dinner and breakfast! The room over looked the Port of San Diego and Coronado Bridge... if you look up and out the view is great! The room was clean, houskeeping was great, the pool awesome and the food too! Be sure to bring your sneakers, because you'll want to walk the Harbor 'boardwalk' every day! Thanks again for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fav hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: caribecouple2010
Reviews.Content: We usually go to San Diego at least once a year and stay at the Hilton Gas Lamp. This time we decided to try the Hilton across the street next to the convention center. We liked this one way better! As a diamond member we get free breakfast which should be redeemable at Starbucks in the hotel but we were upgraded to the buffett. Great food! Bar is nice and chill. We sat outside and enjoyed a drink there. Great view for fireworks at night. You are directly across the street from the Padres stadium. Short walk across the bridge and you are there. We were on a high floor and did not hear the trains at night like you do at the other Hilton. If you have a family they have a kids check in on the weekend. Very cute! We got a cabana one day to sit by the pool. Has a TV which is fun and helps prevent boredom. Drinks at the bat by the pool are great and decent food, make your own tacos. Make sure you try the self serve frozen yogurt place next to Starbucks. Cool concept and reasonably priced. Room was in the corner, a little muggy but was clean and good size.

Reviews.Title: “Brand-new business hotel by the water, but otherwise uninteresting.”
Reviews.Author: PoodleRank
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Hilton Bayfront for one night for a business convention. The Hilton is conveniently located right next to the convention center, and the Petco Park baseball stadium. It's also fairly close to the gaslamp district, though I'm not sure you'd want to walk there, especially at night. On the plus side, the hotel is located right on the water so there are some great water and sunset views. Unfortunately, there's a big container ship harbor right in front as well, so the view was *dominated* by a giant cargo ship. The hotel is also brand new, so the rooms are modern and feels totally clean. The pool and jacuzzi deck also looks like a really nice place to hang out. The decor is modern, with lots of white ... but it just feels quite cold. This hotel ultimately is really just a nice business hotel. It's clean but pricey, relatively convenient but lacks personality. My point of reference is always "would I pay to stay here for leisure". I think there are much more interesting places to stay for leisure in San Diego, but if you have business at the Convention Center, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views!”
Reviews.Author: grlinlv
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel property from what I gathered. We stayed on the 17th floor facing the city and the bay. It was gorgeous! I loved the views, amazing! There is a boardwalk style walk way that you can take from the hotel all the way down to the Seaport Village for food and shopping. There is also a bridge that will take you from the hotel to Petco Park which is the baseball field where the Padres play. The hotel is also right next to the San Diego convention center. This hotel has a great location. It is very light in color, lots of white and blue with light colored wood. It has a clean summer feeling to it. There is a salt water pool that looks out on to the bay. There is a loading and an unloading dock for ships on the left side of the hotel & pool. It didn't really bother me too much. There was a yellow dole pineapple ship unloading for the three days we were there. You will get to see lots of navy ships and some commercial ships come in and out of the bay daily. The area felt very safe and clean. The rooms were very nice. There were three restuarants on site as well as a starbucks and a frozen yogurt shop. The prices were not too terrible. If you can pay the little extra for the view of the city and the bay. It is worth it. There is a ship yard view, I heard it was not so great. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will definately come back. There is a charge of $27 a night for parking, which is in the garage attatched to the hotel. Park on the third floor, there is a small walk way that will bring you to the main entrance of the hotel. I did not like having to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...........”
Reviews.Author: kittychantravel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, Beautiful location, Beautiful weather! What more can I say! This place was great, close the the Gas Lamp district. There are tons of places to walk to and many places are just a very short cab ride away. There wasn't a single negative on this entire trip. I'll be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Wow factor here”
Reviews.Author: dollsiedog
Reviews.Content: Great looking everywhere, great service, great location. Cab fare from the airport is about $14 + tip. Sea World - $25. Zoo - $16. Hotel has fair size rooms for a family of four. The only thing missing is a balcony. Our upgraded room faced the city and we could not have been happier. I can't think of a reason to not go back here next time. This Hilton was wonderful. No need to go to the Manchester unless you want a little bigger of everything - especially the price. Baseball was a 7 minute walk over the new pedestrian bridge. As others have stated it is a little away from everything so expect to walk or catch a taxi bike. Rates on bikes are very negotiable - don't be afraid to make an offer as it works. We have stayed at 20-25 Hilton properties and this one is the best.

Reviews.Title: “poolside music too loud”
Reviews.Author: caligirl175
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bay front for 1 night over the Labor Day Weekend. The hotel is beautiful and the location is fabulous. We arrived around noon and self-parking was a breeze. I did not think $27.00 was unreasonable, being that you had access to many different places. Check in was also a breeze and Ashley who checked us in was very helpful and professional. The room was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious. I was especially looking forward to relaxing by lying by the pool,listening to my ipod and reading my book. The pool is very nice and I loved the temperature in the jacuzzi (not too hot). I noticed when checking in that they would be having a DJ at the pool from 1-4. Sounded like a lot of fun. I love music and dancing but , YOU HAVE GOT TO BE KIDDING ME! The music was so loud I could not even carry on a conversation with my husband sitting right next to me. I realize that you were trying to provide a party atmosphere but when you have many families with small children at the pool that decibel of music is not appropriate even if it's Disney Music being played. Why did it have to be so loud for 3 hours? I finally left with a pounding headache. I couldn't even read my book and when I tried to listen to my ipod I could barely hear it over the music. Would have been a perfect stay sans the pool situation.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with parking, restaurant and cell service in room”
Reviews.Author: KJMgrits
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but they do not own any parking. So if you are driving, you'll have to pay $27 a night. The second night of our stay, there was an event going on and there was NO parking available in the garage and I was forced to valet park the car (which was more money) The restaurant stopped serving breakfast at 11am on saturday unless you wanted to pay for the full buffet. There was horrible cell service in our room and you had to basically sit in the window to use your phone. (WiFi was $12) We had paid for a "upgrade" and found ourselves looking over the "Dole" plant and all their trucks - Disappointing. I have stayed in the hilton across the street in the gaslamp and was much happier with their services and room. I will probably not stay in this hilton again unless absolutely necessary.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant service dissatisfaction”
Reviews.Author: CJeannieB
Reviews.Content: could not reach restaurant to make reservations. Called front desk asked them to reserve. Operator assured us she would contact resturanr to set table for 7. We arrived 20 min later. Very rude hostess Chyenne ststed she never heard from operator and we would just have to wait. There were at least 10 empty tables... But we waited over 30 mins. When we inquired about when we could be seated... Chyenne said I don't know, I had other things to do. We waited another 10 mins & finally one of the waiters pulled 2 tables together for us. Very disappointing as we had invited guests for this dinner. Could it be because a food critic was seated on our patio & all attention was directed toward them? Then, their appetizers were delivere to our table. When we looked puzzled, the waiter returned and wisked the appetizer away & tookit over to their table. Really lousy service for a supposedly upscale resort restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Doogal01
Reviews.Content: I was over charged three nights on my credit card as I elected to pay "upfront" and "save" on the Hilton website - Hmmm... and while the hotel front desk manager took immediate action in sorting out the confusion I am still waiting on resolution in the form a a check to turn up. I'm confident it will as on the whole this hotel is truly a lovely place to stay & I'd like to say a special thank you to Tony - the porter who put up with my complaining about the over-charge and helped me with my luggage. Basically the hotel has everything you need, except room service ends at 11 pm & the internet is not free. When you check in make sure you ask for a room that ends in an odd number - otherwise you will end up with a view of the ugly part of the wharf. Whether I return largely depends on whether my $700+ refund arrives next week. Watch this space. Jo Fredericks Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfrompnwest
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference down the way at the Hyatt. This hotel was a great option, but it is a long walk to the Hyatt (which I appreciated, but some might not). The Hilton is modern and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. I did not go to the pool, but it did look small, but it did have lots of deck space for sunning. My room was on the smaller side, but my rate was very good (I think it was in the $150 range). I only ate at the Fox bar, it was standard bar food, but the service was attentive. There is a full service Starbucks on the ground level, which was good for breakfast. The hotel is beside the convention center and within easy walking distance of the Gaslamp Quarter. I also stayed at the Marriott Marina (the next hotel down from this one) and I much preferred this Hilton property. The Hilton was much more relaxed and less overrun with people.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best San Diego waterfront locations”
Reviews.Author: ScottieMcK
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Bayfront Hotel is one of the best locations for views of the harbor, Petco Park and the city. Conveniently located within a short walk to the "Gas Light District" where there are many fine restaurants, bars and the light rail system or trains north to Los Angeles etc.

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: cbl7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a trade show at the convention center. The location is right next to the convention center and they also have a pedestrian bridge that leads to petco park and the gas lamp district. The hotel is very modern and the lobby area was immaculate. As for the rooms, they are average size, clean and spacious if you have a king room. The view we had selected was Coronado bridge/port view, most of what you see is the dole port with containers everywhere, but the other portion is the Coronado bridge and the bay. an associate was staying on the other side of the hotel and his room had a view of the convention center and the boat harbor with nice yachts as well as the bay. I highly recommend selecting that side. The service was overall good. the room type I had selected was not initially provided, but another employee was able to correct when I went back to the front desk. Lastly, the breakfast buffet at Vela is great and worth money, one of the best I have had at different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “PURE Room Exceptional for My Wife's Condition”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Not only was the Hilton Bayfront an exceptional hotel for our 34th anniversary weekend, even most important it was our first introduction to a PURE Room. My wife has severe (make that extremely severe) reactions to fragrances, perfumes and cigarette smoke. Drives her to migraine headaches requiring heavy meds to resolve. The PURE Room is now on the top or our list as the room did not cause her any problems and allowed for a most enjoyable stay. Before we took control and detoxed our home environment 18 years ago she could experience 5-6 migraines a week. Now it is once or twice a month. Travel is always an issue as there are fragrances everywhere and in most all of the cleaning products used in the rooms. It is always a battle with rooms, cars and airplanes. We just have to stay on it at all times. PURE Rooms are on the top of our list in choosing future hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl523
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We were in town to watch baseball. Petco Park was a short walk over a bridge, so convenient. The hotel is beautiful and the location was perfect. We had an amazing view of downtown San Diego and the water. Couldn't ask for a better location for shopping, train, beach, baseball and the convention center is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: macguire
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hilton. The view was absolutely stunning, looking out over the water and the city. Tried the spa, the massage was good, but I have had better. Nice cocktails at the bar. A nice walk over to the gaslamp quarter, or a short cab ride. Not far from a sweet outdoor shopping mall either. Very nice outdoor pools. Good quality internet speed. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and families”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4123
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a relaxing, intimate hotel experience this may not be the place. On the other hand, if you have an event at the Convention Center this is an amazing hotel. It is a 5-minute walk to the Gaslamp District. The hotel is very clean, almost sterile (which can be a good thing for some people). I gave it a "very good" rating because the hotel staff, valet, bell hops and restaurants are very good. I was there for business and my needs we met and usually exceeded. It's just not the intimate, couple retreat. Pick a smaller hotel in the Gaslamp District if that is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and nice walks”
Reviews.Author: lmichaelson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and spacious, right next to the Convention Center. It is also walking distance to the Ballpark, Seaport Village and Gaslamp District. The Tenth Avenue Marine Terminal is to the south and it was fun to lay by the pool and watch them unload bananas off the Dole ship. We actually live in San Diego, but we enjoy these kind of staycations in our own backyard because we can park the car and forget about it the rest of the weekend and just explore on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Family trip”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun061_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern and comfortable. Only three years old. The self parking was convenient .( park on the third floor, the walkway leads you to the front of the hotel). Enjoyed using the uncrowded fitness area. The pool is designed with the Hilton emblem. Alot more families than expected. Convenient to the convention center, Gaslamp area and a bridge from the hotel to Petco ballpark. Love that! Enjoyed the breakfast and the lovely patios in each restaurant and bar. The rooms are nice and the beds are very comfortable. No refrigerators but you can request one for an extra charge. Staff were all great. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: sumsuuum
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel. This hotel is not directly in the gaslamp, but definitely not a far walk to the beginning of the gaslamp. I easily walked in heels and all around the gaslamp. It is also directly on the water, which is beautiful! You can see the Coronado Bridge from some rooms. This was a very nice, modern hotel. I loved it and will definitely be going back if need be. The pricing is usually cheaper than all other hotels in downtown San Diego too. The price I paid was definitely worth the stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Summer Trip”
Reviews.Author: xbodenx
Reviews.Content: We booked their summer fun and sun package at the hotel and stayed 2 nights. So we were suppose to get free parking and 35 dollars a night to spend at the hotel. When we got their they asked if we were going to need parking not even noticing that we had it paid for in our package. When I said it is paid for in the package he had to look it up. Then told us to charge the room for the 35 dollars a night. We stayed in a large corner room looking over the bay. The room was great. Tons of room, nice view and a nice bed. The hotel itself was nice lots of things to do at the hotel. The pool was packed during the day so we my girlfriend and me went down later in the day and it was really nice. The pool wasnt that cold and the hot tub wasnt to hot. They also had pool toys to play with if you wanted to. We walked around most of the time and there is tons of stuff to do after you leave to the hotel also. Service was ok we had the problem at the front desk with the parking but it wasnt that bad. The service throughout the hotel was good. But i did get charged for the 35 dollars a night that was included in our package and had to call to get it fixed. The value was nice for the hotel and as much as they offer but if I book a special package I would like them to follow through with it and not have to be reminded of it. Sleep quality we were on the 28th floor and away from the elevator so there was no extra noise and the bed was nice. Cleanliness the room was very clean. When we were first going up to our room there was a cupcake all over the floor by the elevator and about 30 minutes later when we came back down it was still there. Also the fox sports grill the first time we went our table wasnt wiped down that well but the seceond time it was good. Outside of those things the hotel was very clean. Spa we only went to the pool but it was nice we spent longer down there then we thought we would. Restaurants they offer the two once is expensive we didnt go to it. The fox sports grill was good. We were disapointed when we went to the starbucks and frozen yogurt they have on site because you cant charge it to the room but they were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, awful Dole boat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen1966_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights as a family of four at the beginning of August. Booked the Coronado View Room at an extra cost. When we pulled up to the hotel it was very impressive. Our room was not ready and we had to wait 1 1/2 hours even though it was 4.00pm. We were given vouchers to spend at Starbucks while we waited though. Having paid extra for the Coronad view room we were VERY disappointed to see that there was a gigantic Dole boat right outside the window!! In fact we kept the curtains shut on that side of the room as this was not the view we had anticipated. It was there for 4 days out of the 6!!! Sitting around the pool the music had to be played louder to cover the sound of the boat being unloaded. Such a shame as we loved the hotel. in none of the Hiltons advertisements does it show the a view from the hotel to the left showing this it is cleverly shot showing the view over the harbour to Seaport Village. Would stay here again but ask for a different view.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay here and I plan to keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: cjb11711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront in August 2011 (as well as May 2010) and I enjoyed both stays tremendously. The service is at this hotel is top level. The employees are very friendly and helpful. Every person I came in contact with was warm and friendly. The hotel is also immaculately clean. I believe the hotel is fairly new and it has been kept up very well. It is located right next to the convention center and across from the Gaslamp Quarter. There is a pedestrian walkway that will take you from the 3rd level of the hotel's parking deck right over to the Petco Park area, so getting to and around the Gaslamp Quarter is very quick and easy. My suggestion is that if you are driving to the hotel and you have an older GPS, use the address for the convention center (111 West Harbor Drive) instead of the One Park Blvd address, but my GPS could not find One Park Blvd and it made getting to the hotel the first time a bit confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great rate!”
Reviews.Author: PokeMomNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Pokemon Worlds for four nights. I found out that if you book only two or three rooms at a time, you get a lower rate than if you book seven nights in a row. I got a lovely room with two queen beds for $169 per night. The room was clean, comfortable and had all necessary amenities. The front desk was AMAZING and knew the answers to all of my questions. They even have an Enterprise rental car desk next to the check-in area that had good rates for rentals. We used a car when we drove to LEGOLAND. I highly recommend this hotel. Oh, and NO bedbugs!!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: stacebarrett
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful lobby/entrance and pool area. Our room was nice as well. This hotel is situated right on the bay, at the end of the walkway/boardwalk. You are able to walk all the way from this hotel, past the marina into the village seaport. If you are going to a Padres game, it's a short walk to the stadium right over a walkway bridge. The staff was very pleasant and always willing to help and give advice. One day we felt like just relaxing, since it was vacation...and lounging by the pool was perfect... Good to know there is an enterprise car rental associate right in the building! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: isobelmalloy
Reviews.Content: This is a modern well located hotel close to the lively Gaslamp Area. The pool area did not have enough loungers. Water in the room was charged for[bottled.] Car parking was slightly reduced for hotel guests. Internet charges too were high. Glad we got a 3 nights for 2 price otherwise this hotel would have been a costly option.

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary and loved the location. It is right next to the convention center and across the street (pedestrian bridge) from Petco Park. You can easily walk to the Gaslamp quarter and to Seaport Village. There is a nice walking/running path behind the convention center with a view of the water/marina--it leads right to Seaport Village. The hotel staff is sincerely friendly and helpful--everyone we talked to -including the parking lot attendants were super friendly and nice. I was hoping when we checked in we might get an upgrade because of our special occasion, but there wasn't really anything available. Much to our surprise, when we returned after dinner, there was a bottle of champagne and some munchies as well as a note from the desk clerk Jacob who checked us in! What a nice touch and we were so happy that for a big hotel chain, they gave us that personal touch. The room was large and the bathroom actually had plenty of light! Nice size towels and room to put things down on the vanity. The king size bed had plenty of nice pillows and was so comfy. My only negative is the internet/wifi is not free and I didn't want to pay for it. We had their summer fun special-including parking and $35 per day voucher, which we used for breakfast. There is also a Starbucks and yogurt shop right outside. The pool area is nice as well as the fitness room. They provide several free activities on the weekend-including beer/meatballs one night and wine/cheese another. Just a great experience overall. We can't wait until we can return.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING FOR A HILTON”
Reviews.Author: DurhamTeddy
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked fab as we pulled up, but although it was huge and immaculately clean, we were disappointed with the service we recieved. The valet service was the only exception to this they were very efficient and friendly. Inside there was no help with luggageno prob for us as we are able bodied but may be difficult for others), and staff were not particularly helpful, perhaps they were having a bad couple of days or were busy. Also there were lots of extra's eg wi fi, parking etc. given the cost of staying here surely some of this could be absorbed, after all you can get free wi fi in travel lodges. but on the whole lovely hotel, which was very close to the shops bars etc and the rooms were a good size with coffee and tea making facilities, I would say by all means go to this but if your expecting the Hilton to be a "cut above" you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: vita_bene
Reviews.Content: My wife and I home-based here for 3 days while we made daily excursions around the county. The hotel is immediately across a side-street from the SD Convention Center, on an embarcardero across Harbor Drive from the Gaslamp area, on the San Diego Bay. Orientation of the hotel is E-W (so rooms face either north or south). Our 23rd-floor room faced south, providing a perfect view of...the Dole (as in fruits) freight yard immediately to the south of the property, where a freighter that was in port was being worked the whole time we were there. It actually wasn't offensive to look at, as the operations were neat and orderly. But we were poolside one afternoon and the engine/generator noise coming from the freighter was a little more pronounced than just white noise in the background. I say it's the perfect business hotel because the lobby, access, and public areas are all business. It's like being in a class "A" downtown high-rise office building. Expansive open spaces, tall ceilings, lots of wood and stone surfaces, escalators to move you up and down to the street level, and meeting rooms right off the lobby. It's clearly not catering to kids (though there were many families there) and that was just fine. The pool is a token pool, not very large, not intended for all-day leisure. We did enjoy massages at the spa, attached to the fitness center. Good service, good-sized (not too small, not Las Vegas-opulent). Again, clearly targeted at the business traveler. I was a little disappointed with the bed which seemed a little springy and cheap for the quality of the hotel. As a business hotel it's a very easy recommendation. But if you're looking for a kid-friendly destination property this is not your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gambit4Hire
Reviews.Content: Be sure to bring your wallet with enough cash to pay for all the sneeky extras this hotel will charge you. They don't tell you that parking is a fee per night and once you check out slap you with a hefty bill, after you just paid for an overpriced room. There is very limited parking in the area, and difficult to park several blocks away when carrying luggage. Can't say that the rooms are anything to write about. I would not stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CancunVoyager
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and brand new Hotel with an excellent location and cheaper than some of the area. In front of the downtown San Diego and a splendid view of the bay. Rooms a bit small but cozy Excellent choice for business and weekend travelers

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lacking some desired amenities”
Reviews.Author: squifty
Reviews.Content: While the room was nice and seemed newer, the property lacked certain common amenities that many other less expensive hotels offer, such as free wifi or some design and layout issues in the hotel itself. If you want to eat at the Fox Sports Grill, you must go outside and walk around the exterior of the hotel. To exit the hotel at ground level, you cannot take the elevator, you have to take the elevator to the lobby and then go down an escalator to get to the ground level, which is very inconvenient. The hotel did offer a nice package where you can buy 2 passes for their lavish breakfast buffet for only $25, a $45 value. The passes are for their Vela restaurant, which offered a nice selection that varied day to day. The food was definitely above average and well worth the $25 for both of us to eat breakfast without having to walk into the Gaslamp quarter early each morning. The location of the hotel is very convenient to the convention center as well as the Gaslamp quarter. We walked through the Gaslamp each night and even to the local outdoor mall. There is no need to drive here, since everything is within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Mumnelsk
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely hotel in a nice position, ideal for gas lamp district, which was gorgeous, but unfortunately the hotel was a let down, but poor and unhelpful staff (except car vallets, who were excellent.) everything seemed to incur extra costs, eg, parking, wifi, water in the room, which given the cost of the Hilton, was disappointing. Swimming pool was very small and limited sun beds, think there are better quality hotels at a better price than the Hilton, which let's itself down..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, facility, meals, and service!”
Reviews.Author: rob0495
Reviews.Content: We organize a conference at this lovely hotel in mid-June. The entire hotel--staff from every department, from the Front Desk to the Manager, the dining options in the hotel, the facility itself, and the venue--was wonderful to work with throughout! Over the course of 5 days we had committee meetings, plenary sessions, workshops, and receptions and all were very well received and appreciated by the 635 attendees. It was one of our more successful events, and the hotel and their excellent staff and wonderful meals played a staring role in enabling us to achieve our results. Many of the conference attendees specifically commented (very favorably) on the hotel, its staff, the general venue, and the easy access to downtown and its many fine restaurants. The staff and management were brilliant to work with and we are hopeful that we will be able to return in the near future. Thanks Hilton San Diego Bayfront!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and perfect for Petco Park”
Reviews.Author: tctran08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very professional and friendly. A staff member, Aricele, treated us with excellent service and a friendly attitude the moment we stepped into the hotel. They accommodated every request we had. The rooms were a good size and the beds were extremely comfortable. No refridgerator in our room though. Since it is next to the convention center, you will notice that the clientele will be largely business people. So if you're going to San Diego for leisure, this is something you might wanna think about. The pool is decent size and includes a walk up bar. The only drawback may be that since it is right on the bay, it can get windy at times. If you're looking to go to a baseball game at Petco Park, all you have to do is take a 5 minute walk across the bridge and you're there. All in all, the location is very convenient to the gaslamp quarter, and a very clean and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: BAYOGM
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel and I only can say it is a very good hotel. Wonderful view from 29th floor, excelent service, clean, nice food, although they charge $34 for valet parking, wich I think it is very expensive. But for the kind of hotel, and the fact that I was using crutches at that time, it's was woth the price. Search for a good deal that includes brakefast, the buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be...”
Reviews.Author: MeuterMedia
Reviews.Content: we booked the Summer package including free self parking ($26 per day) and did not use the car for the 3 days. Tram to Old Town, walk across the street (bridge) to GasLamp District and Horton Plaza, walk along the bay to Seaport Village, take the ferry to Coronado. That's all we had time for... wonderful location, recommend upgrading to an upper floor and a corner unit (room 2166) Bridge and Dole unloading dock view as well as the ball park and gas lamp district view. We originally had reservations for the Hyatt, but the package deal was much better. Try the breakfast at McCormock and Schmidt across the street (bridge). MeuterMedia

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, service average”
Reviews.Author: LiscomeBay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a convention which seemingly took over the entire property. While the property is nicely located along the waterfront directly across from PETCO Park, offering great views, the decor in the lobby is quite odd and minimal at best. I felt the service at the property was significantly substandard and I personally encountered about three front office staff, all who appeared to have an attitude issue. I tried two of the restaurants and found one acceptable, one not so much. The Fox Sports Grill while "part of the hotel" cannot be accessed via any inside effort. One must go outside into the weather and walk around the hotel, or behind the hotel along the water to get into this location. Once inside the menu is typical of a sports bar, however, this restaurant had absolutely zero sports memorabilia on the wall with practically zero atmosphere. I was surprised it was a Fox Sports Grill The hotel accommodations are certainly very nice with comfortable beds and bedding and my particular room looked towards town and the water. If you choose to stay at this hotel I'm not certain it is worth the price compared to many of the other equally pleasant hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and it was adequate. I liked that it was across the tracks from the Gaslamp Quarter. Good access with a pedestrian bridge but away from the fray. It was also nice to be on the water and next to an open park. Having a Starbucks and yogurt place on property is a plus. Room was spacious and appointed in the new Hilton fashion. Fantastic view. I can see how this would be the best place to be during a convention. A few disappointments: valet was ridiculously slow, even after calling from the room to bring the car. There were about a dozen valet employees but no sense of urgency to bring my car from the garage which I could have easily walked to and retrieved my car much more quickly. Paid extra to bring a dog and was not provided with the paid-for dog amenities. Had to call housekeeping twice to have them delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: lexandraMtz
Reviews.Content: I love it! I will definitely be back(: Its close to the zoo, beach & downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: fr3houston
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to my stay in this hotel, and am just not impressed, considering their typical rates. Luckily I had a conference discount so I didn't pay an outrageous rate - but I was still expecting a certain level of quality. What was good: 1) The view - even in a standard room, beyond the humongous Dole shipments, there's a peek at the bay, which is wonderful. 2) They have a UPS store in the hotel, which was a lifesaver since I have no car 3) It appears to be a pretty convenient location - not far from the airport, easy/safe to walk around 4) Clean rooms What was bad: 1) I am thoroughly disappointed in the room service. I sincerely felt like they had cheaped out on the food, which again, from an "upscale" hotel, I was not expecting this. The first night, it was a bento box whose largest portion of the box contained nothing but cherry tomatoes. It had about an inch of hummus (no exaggeration!), two pieces of chicken kabob, and a small salad. I was starving and had to run down and get a snack just to fill myself up. Tonight I decided to give up on being healthy so I ordered the pizza from downstairs. The chicken was barely on the pizza, and the cheese was absolutely terrible. 2) The rooms and bathrooms are okay, but again - i've seen much nicer in less expensive hotels 3) The shampoo/conditioner they provided actually dried my hair out - which has never happened! I always use the hotel shampoo and conditioner, even if i'm in a cheaper hotel - and have never had a problem with it. My hair is brittle and dry thanks to the hotel amenities! Considering how many hotels are in this area - I would recommend looking for another one, that might be less expensive and may have better services.

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: PnSfromLA
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern, with a nice lobby. Rooms were a little small but felt practically new. The plusses for this hotel are: Modern, great views of Downtown and the Embarcadero, close to the Gaslamp District, comfy beds. Cons: Price is a little steep, and rooms are a little small. Would definately stay here again when I visit San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BestViews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived here after a seven hour flight from another country. Despite having made the reservations six months in advance, our room was not ready. This, in spite of the fact that we arrived at normal check-in time. All we wanted was to unpack and freshen up after the long flights. It took over two hours for our room to be ready, The front desk staff apologized saying that they gave us a free upgrade to a room with a better view. When I told them their "upgrade" was what I had originally ordered they didn't know what to say. They also lied to us. When our room wasn't ready, the desk staff gave us the room keys anyway but kept the room number from us. They would give us the room number once it was ready. Well, after an hour of waiting, I went back to the front desk to get an update and the desk staff called for a room status and I overheard the room number. I was told it still wasn't ready. Another hour and a half of waiting and I again went back to the from desk. This is where they told me about a free upgrade to another room as our original room still wasn't ready. The room they gave us was the same one that I had overheard earlier. I told the check-in person that this was not an upgrade and was the same room as earlier. She didn't say anything. The second disappointment was the advertising over the outside of the building. The advertisment obstructed the view outside. It was bad enough during the day but at night, the view of the city was a blurry, mess of buildings and lights. This is not a cheap hotel and they should not have put up advertising on the outside of guest windows. I probably won't stay here again. We changed hotels after a week and moved to the Westin Gaslamp. That was a much better location and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: FredPT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Diego staying at the Bayfront. It started out bad because when we arrived at 10:30pm our room was not ready, but we got called within 20 min. After that, every part of our stay was great. The rooms, location, hotel amenities, this was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. My family wanted to extend our visit. Get a city side view, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst bar service at the Odysea”
Reviews.Author: kewlflower
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I spent the week-end at this lovely relatively new hotel. They upgraded us to a large room with a bayfront view. The hotel service was good and the Vela restaurant food was delish. I would have rated this higher had it not been for the Odysea bar. The female bartenders were mostly Eastern European foreigners and spoke their language to each other in front of customers. They were very rude to us girls although they were were very nice to the guys. They kept hitting on men the entire night (they needed green cards?) and ignored us. Everytime we needed a drink it took an act of congress for them to serve us. They didn't like it when some of the men talked to us. We kept getting dirty looks. This was the worst experience I've had in a hotel bar. Definitely will not be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Crisp, Clean, Bright Modern Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alohaboys4
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the hotel a few days ago and had a wonderful short visit. I'm a HHonors Gold Members so I was upgraded to a nice bay view room on the 16th floor. Rm 1619 has a nice 32" LCD Television, large glass windows facing the San Diego Bay, and a really nice upscale work/desk chair. Everything in the room was bright, clean and crisp including the furniture and bedding. Very nice comfortable king bed and feather pillows too. The room was a nice size, plenty of space without feeling cramped. In room coffee maker was the single serve pod type which made a great cup of coffee in about 90 seconds :-) The bathroom was bright, well light and very clean. The bathroom linens were very high quality and soft to the touch. The sink vanity area had plenty on room for your stuff. The bathroom amenities were by Peter Thomas Roth, shampoo, soaps, body lotion, etc all good quality product. The front desk was able to check me in early about 130pm and everyone was polite and friendly. The hotel offers a nice pool area with a salt water pool and whirpool both overlooking the bay area. The lobby area was again bright, clean and modern, had a nice upscale feel to it without trying to be too trendy like the W Hotels. I did have two minor issues, I couldn't get the in room or lobby WiFi to work with my IPad at all, I tried everything! Finally, I just went to the Starbucks located on the first floor and had no problems using my IPad within 20 seconds. I gusess Starbucks has better WiFi service that the Hilton. The other problem was the self parking area which was very busy and hard to locate a spot. Also, the parking area only had one worker handling everyone leaving the day I departed. Some would say the location is a little off the beaten path and too far away from the Gas Lamp District but I found it to be fine since you can walk to the Gas Lamp Area within 10 minutes and even Sea Port Village within 12-15 minutes. I wish more Hilton Hotels were like this one! The hotel is even pet friendly and I saw several nice dogs around the property. I would rate the hotel Very Good, if the WiFi worked properly then I would have rated it Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but parking is an issue”
Reviews.Author: 50statestraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend. We loved the location as it is a short walk across the bridge to Petco Park and a short walk to Seaport Village and the Gaslamp District. The main problem is the parking which is $27 to self park or $35 (I think) to valet. If you happen to be there when a Padres game or another event is going on, the parking lot tends to fill up.It took us 1/2 hour to get out of the parking lot one morning due to some sort of pet event and we stayed away until the Padres game was over because we knew we wouldn't be able to find parking. The room wasn't ready at the 3 pm check in time but they called us when it was ready a half an hour later and they didn't give us our points on our Hilton Honors card because we booked the room through another site when Hilton said there were no rooms available for the days we wanted. Other than that it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great fun”
Reviews.Author: JasonRattray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently after dinner downtown. What a joy!!!! Totally different from other downtown hotels as this one combines a boutique feel with a big hotel accomodations. Alot of fun and perfectly placed if you are going to a baseball game.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Views, Wonderful, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kg90036
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Sunday night for a quick business trip. Had a corner bay/city view room on the 14th floor. The accommodations were excellent, clean and comfortable. Went to several of the on site bars and eateries and had a fantastic time at each. Attentive service and very very good drinks and food. Room service breakfast was quick and tasty. Had an early Monday morning massage in the on site spa; the facilities and staff were excellent. All the staff I encountered were very very pleasant and it was clear that they wanted to take good care of all their customers. This hotel is at the south end of the bay front hotels and it is cool to look south and see the freighter ship unloading, then you look north and right there is the convention center and all the other hotels lined up along the bay. Look north east and you see Petco Park/Gaslamp district and the city. Look the opposite direction and its the bay and Coronado you see, and if you're up high enough the Pacific Ocean.This hotel is a gem. Yes, the views are great, the location is fine, The bars and restaurants are very very good, but the clincher for me was the staff. What wonderful service I experienced especially at the front desk, the spa, Vela bar and restaurant, and Odysea bar/lounge! I will definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hilton is better than the Waldorf!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl33364
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Honors members and have stayed at many Hilton's around the world including the Waldorf and other Waldof collection hotels and this hotel is by far the best! Every single staff member we had contact with was plesant, helpful and kind and any request was taken care of right away. The room we had was perfection. We stayed in room 1065 with a view of the bay and the city. It was just high enough to have a great view and low enough to still be able to see what was going on in the city and at Petco field. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very clean and a great size for our family of 4. We stayed here while on a family vacation and upon returning home we asked our kids, 11 and 13, "What was your favorite part of our trip?" They both said staying at the bayfront and walking to sea port village along the bay each night. That is very impressive considering we used the City Pass and went to Universal Studios, Sea World, San Diego Zoo and Disneyland! We highly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants top notch service and a beautiful, clean and comfortable place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed expectation”
Reviews.Author: ventsurlonde
Reviews.Content: We generally prefer small boutique hotels over big corporate chain hotels, since you don't get much service from corporate chain like Hilton. We set our expectation quite low and the property fared better than what we expected. We went down to San Diego for July 4th, Hilton Bayfront was offering a competitive rate at the time. We booked a city view room since we want to be able to see fireworks and I know bridgeview/bayview rooms are facing the opposite direction. The property is obvious target corporate people, or nightlife. It's not a hotel I'll recommended for beach goers. The hotel is very modern and beautiful, though the layout is a bit unusual if not weird. Location is great though, except if you want to go to the beach. but its close proximity to the convention center downtown and Gaslamp district as well as marina promenade. It does have easy access to Coronado bridge. The room amenities are standard decent quality, bed is comfortable, clean. Room service is good. And the location is excellent for fireworks viewing, in face, the local TV station set up the broadcast booth right on the front lawn of the hotel. Parking is expensive though and like a typical Hilton, don't expect much service. It was extremely crowded at the pool area because its July 4th weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: engine33
Reviews.Content: We went here for a weekend getaway and had picutre perfect weather that San Diego is known for. The hotel is modern and clean with well maintained grounds. If you are looking to hang out in the gaslamp quarter, bring good walking shoes, as it is a good 10+ minute walk from the hotel. The outdoor pool was nice and had comfortable chairs to lounge in. There also is a paved promenade that runs along the water, great for taking walks. There also is now a skybridge to get across to Petco Park and the Gaslamp quarter, but it still is q good 10-20 minute walk from the hotel to this area. The restaurants within the hotel were completely understaffed. We tried to get breakfast one morning and were told it was a 45 minute wait. There were probably 20 tables that were completely empty! It was obvious they decided to understaff the restaurant and were not able to run at full capacity. Very disappointing! The Good: Pool Well priced Very close to Coronado Ferry Great views of downtown & water Rooms nicely appointed, comfortable beds and linens/towels The Bad: No free wi-fi Restaurants were understaffed to handle capacity Long walk to Gaslamp Quarter Would we stay here again, probably, but I think next time we will find something closer to gaslamp quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else !”
Reviews.Author: wineanddinesandiego
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton over the weekend of July15/16. The check in process was very unprofessional, and the front desk agent was rude. The food and beverage outlets were over-priced, and lacking ambiance. Our guest room was average and the view looked at a banana freighter. Most of the staff was not friendly and seamed that they did not care about their jobs. I was looking forward to my stay but was quite disappointed. I would NOT recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was nice but the amenities were lacking”
Reviews.Author: TawnyaG
Reviews.Content: A group of girl friends stayed here for a stagette on the April Long weekend, Our room was large with comfy beds and furniture. We were disappointed that there was no free wifi provided as many other large hotel chains have and the room service later in the evening was really lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Courteous”
Reviews.Author: DellaW
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for Comic-Con 2011. This is a very big work week for me, and this hotel does a ton of business. Thankfully, they were 100% ready for the crowds. Every staff member was exceptionally kind and went out of their way to help. My only complaint is that the back conference rooms are a dead zone for internet. Which is pretty crucial when you're covering a convention of this magnitude. But that is only one complaint. The room service, housekeeping, front desk and rest of the staff were all on their A-Game. I would stay here again if I needed to be close to the convention center and the Gas Lamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class!”
Reviews.Author: weedebs
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Bayfront for 9 days in early June. I was there on business as my company was holding a large event there. I had stayed there 3 times prior to this, while we were in the planning stages and each time I have enjoyed my stay tremendously. How do I begin? The rooms are excellent. The food is excellent and the cocktails are amazing. The Spa is also wonderful! Rooms: I love the beds, the view, the amenities. . .you name it. I've stayed in a regular room, one of their new "PUR" rooms and this last time I had a Suite. I can't fault any of them. Then there's the bar. . .Odysea is wonderful. They make classic cocktails, like the French 75 and a mean Manhattan. Plus specialty cocktails that change with the seasons. Knowledgable bartenders, friendly staff and the appetizers are great too. The food at Vela was outstanding, though the server we had on one occasion could have used a little caffeine to get him moving. The service was very slow. The breakfast buffet is very good, if a little pricey. . . but then again, it is San Diego and the location adds onto the price. The spa services were wonderful and the pool is a dream. Overall, Highly recommended. I'd stay there on my own dime anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, on water close to gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: bobeena
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to watch the 4th of July fireworks for a really good deal through local promotion. Rooms were very nice, clean and good views. Also liked there is a Fox Sports Grill on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Comic Con”
Reviews.Author: traveldel
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything for the service since I spent my entire day at Comic Con but I do love the location - just one block away and on the same side as the convention center. It was wonderful being so close. I didn't have to wait with the crowds to cross the street at the train tracks, it was so easy getting back to the hotel for afternoon breaks. I loved the room - it was nicely decorated and had lots of natural lighting. The bed was soooo comfortable! The bathroom was simple but very clean- could have been more fancy for the price of the place I guess. There was also a Starbucks downstairs to feed my iced Mocha addiction every morning. I guess my only complaint would be the price - for 320$/night it didn't even include internet. I'm used to having free internet as a standard for every place I stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but rude service totally cancels it out! Never going back.”
Reviews.Author: tesseract68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and will probably avoid this hotel. It really is beautiful, with incredible eye-catching decor not just in the lobby but also tasteful pieces in the guest rooms. However, it's not worth it when it comes to the service. Every person I encountered (front desk, concierge, etc.) treated me rudely or coolly. By far the worst part about it was when I was checking out--they handed me my hotel bill in a SEALED envelope at the final moment and then started serving the next person in line, so that I couldn't review the charges before leaving. I have stayed in numerous hotels and NEVER have I encountered this before at any hotel--usually I am asked to review the charges before they actually charge me, in case there is anything amiss on them. I thought that this was really strange. So, just to make sure, while I'm standing there, I open the envelope to review the bill, and lo and behold, find a charge on there that wasn't mine, for pizza. I had it corrected, though it was incredibly awkward with the person after me being helped, and the staff member behaving as though correcting a charge was a huge inconvenience for her. The other downside about this hotel is that they nickel and dime you for little things that other hotels would not charge you for (internet, use of the gym, etc., and I didn't even use the parking garage), so it appears to be cheaper but in reality is probably just as or more expensive than other hotels in the area. In addition, it is a busy hotel--when I was there, there were probably two different meetings going on simultaneously, so the lobby was often crowded and full of people. The location of the hotel is both good and bad--it has great views of the water, and is right next to the convention center. However, it is a little bit more of a hike to the restaurants in the Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel - Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: BrianTheTraveler77
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and a quiet location. All rooms either have a bay view or a harbor view so you can't go wrong. Wonderful walking path directly accross the street. Pet friendly. Town/Gaslight district is a short 5-minute drive but lots of parking so not a problem. The quietness of the location of the hotel and the great views more than make up for it's "isolation". Great staff, restaraunt and room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: Juaners
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best Hilton properties in the states. Located right on the bay, you get amazing views of the city and Coronado Island. The hotel is clean, crisp and the staff from the valet to the front desk were accommodating. We were given a room in the 19th floor overlooking the city/bay area. The hotel loses points for having a giant ad on the north facing side of the hotel. It made our room darker as it prevented sunlight from coming in. HH rejoice! Free appetizers in the Vela bar for each night stay. You also get the standard continental breakfast from the Starbucks on the ground level, however for $10 you can upgrade to the Buffet. Overall, a very good experience and I would stay here in a heartbeat. The hotel is situated next to the convention center and across the street from the Stadium. Easy to walk in Downtown or a short cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “they lost my top!!”
Reviews.Author: duemilaetre
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very good and clean, nice view(which you pay) But after the cleaning lady came to remake the bed..I could not find any more my new top which I had left on the bed.It was very disappoining as when I went and ask the reception they did not help at hall.I could choose to not doing anything or make an official report.Too much for a top!!But for the price you pay they could at least give you a free drink when something like that happens!

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront”
Reviews.Author: Isabella89
Reviews.Content: What was suppose to be a lovely weekend to celebrate my 50th birthday became a nightmare the minute we arrived at the Hilton Front Desk at 3:30pm. We were told that our room was not ready and placed us in another room without asking us if it was okay. The person in the front desk just talked real fast and gave us the key to a room that was not what we had reserved weeks before. When we told them we did not want that room and that we would like to get what we reserved we were lied to by say the room is not cleaned and will that they will let us know when the room would be ready. 5 hours later no phone call at all and we had to approach the front desk and ended up staying in room facing construction work, and with all our plans ruined. This has been the worst experience in a hotel and I would never recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. It is overrated. This is what we asked for and the Hilton confirmed to have it ready for us "CORONADO VW 1 KING BED RM" We also waited with many other hotel guests for their rooms so there is no telling what happened to them.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SVillanueva
Reviews.Content: Great weekend get away with my boyfriend and our puppy. This is a great dog friendly hotel. We had a wonderful time. Beautiful view of the bridge. Walking distance to Gaslamp District and Seaport Village. Starbucks directly on the first floor. A nice grassy area for your dog to enjoy. Our room was very clean and spacious. We got a Deluxe King room. Enough room for us and our dog. We brought his crate with us. He was very quiet and it wasn't noisy at all with neighboring hotel guests that had dogs as well. Will definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time and Fun”
Reviews.Author: VacationLoverLA
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Hilton San Diego Bayfront it is one of the best hotel i ever stayed it is a brand new hotel great location, one of the best design ever, huge lobby. great employees, we had a problem at their buffet we brought problem to top manager (Tom) there was no defense of employee , their action was so professional. if you looking for neat and clean hotel it is the place, prices are so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: miketayas
Reviews.Content: Great service throughout the hotel.Excellent food of all types

Reviews.Title: “Modern ocean front resort with fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: Yum E
Reviews.Content: Did a 2 night stay at this resort due to a huge special this property was having. Parking, a $27 value, was included in my room rate. Since I was Hilton Honors Gold VIP, 2 bottles of water, 2 coffees & pastries, along with 2 appetizers were complimentary, as was the Internet. Jorge, my check-in agent, was courteous and friendly. He explained things very well. As a Hilton Honors Gold VIP, I was also upgraded to the top floor, 30th, and given a room w/ the city view. The room was brand new as the property was completed in 2008. The mattress and towels were all very comfortable and luxurious. In addition, the room was also very quiet w/ the central HVAC in the room. The breakfast buffet was top notch at $21.95. It consisted of the standard omelet station, ham, bacon, sausage stations along with the bread and fruit stations. The croissants were tasty since they were freshly baked. I'll definitely stay here again, if the property continues to have great rates! :D

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean!”
Reviews.Author: coffeeluver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for July 4th weekend. It was very busy. Check in was fast and front desk service was really nice and friend. Had to remind the girl at front desk that we booked a room w/ breakfast buffet at VELA. Breakfast at Vela was really nice, good food w/ many options. Staff was really friendly and helpful. It is a bit of a walk to Seaport village if you have young children. Overall, it is a great hotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AmarilloByMorning
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a port/Coronado room with breakfast included. The hotel was packed for the July 4th weekend, but our room was surprisingly quiet and comfortable. It.certainly was not the most luxurious of accommodations, but the location was great for Gaslamp Quarter exploring, and it could not have been more ideal for the fabulous Big Bay Boom fireworks celebration. We were impressed with the variety (if not the organization) of the included breakfast buffet in the Vela restaurant. We paid $11 each night for a $50 breakfast buffet for two, and it was well worth the frustration of dealing with the unruly children of clueless enabling parents. While wireless was not included in our package and parking charges are exorbitant all over San Diego, we felt that the Hilton Bayfront provided good value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Arizona03
Reviews.Content: Superb location and great view. Very friendly staffs and kids friendly with programs throughout each day while were there fourth of July weekend . Wish could have stay longer. Will definitely go back there when in San Diego next time. Only parking got a bit full due to concert nearby since it wasn't just for hotel guests. Also pet friendly and enjoyed watching all different types of dogs roaming around.

Reviews.Title: “substandard service”
Reviews.Author: advancetraveler
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, but service at the restaurant and bars were slow and unprofessional. the staff were unorganized and seemed new to the business. the house keeping they just made the beds, did not clean room or bathroom. won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “I was wowed”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for 3 nights over 4th of July weekend. Two episodes in the hotel lobby set the whole tone for me. First, the desk clerk was happy to see us. Not because it was in her script. And not with a paste-on-smile. She sincerely enjoyed her work, and wanted to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. ( I wish I could remember her name, but her badge said she was from Ohio) A few feet away, they had a kid's check-in. 2 hotel staff, both with polo shirts rather than blazers and ties, were giving the kids grab bags and talking up the weekend. The kids in the elevator couldn't wait to show us their new sunglasses, etc. It's a big hotel, located next door to the convention center. But, they make a big hotel feel personal, not corporate. I was wowed. Only shortcoming: the parking ramp is not well marked. We moved the car 2x each day, and had trouble remembering where we parked. The hotel doesn't own the lot, so I can't fault them...but even putting A, B, C on the posts would allow us to remember where on the 3rd floor we left the car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for convention centre and gaslamp quarter”
Reviews.Author: chc69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference in the convention centre. Location: right beside the convention centre so couldn't be better. Nice view of the downtown bay area from the hotel rooms/bar etc. Across the road from 5th avenue, the main part of the gaslamp quarter. Public areas: efficient and helpful check-in and guest services. Nice bar area with outside overlooking water. Breakfast had many options although was a bit "mass produced" and very busy. Didn't use the gym. Rooms: plenty of space and facilities; overall modern and comfortable Overall I'd recommend, especially for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jessica_montpellier
Reviews.Content: great hotel directly at the bay and just 10min walk from the gaslamp quarter with plenty of restaurants, bars etc. Parking is very expensive (27 dollar). The hotel is brand new modern and has good facilities. The chain character didnt bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but better for business than a vacation”
Reviews.Author: MMM27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Bayfront for a week in November, 2010 for a conference taking place there. First of the good: The room and bathroom was very, never had a problem with the maid service and she always tidied up my shopping purchases of the day (the Gaslight shopping district is just down the street) I had a view towards the harbour and it was great to see the sunrise over San Diego every morning. The hotel is clean, decently run and nicely decorated in a loose ocean theme, which while not my style, was very clean and modern. There are free iPad's in the lobby lounge so you can check your email. However they are located in the bar area so I assume they'd like you to order a drink while you surf. I never did as the drink prices were really high. I only tried the Sportsbar Grill at the resort but I found the food there to be quite good and fairly priced for the most part. They also have free wifi at the restaurant. The Cons: The wifi was expensive in the hotel (up to $18 a day) and rarely worked well, especially in the conference rooms. For a hotel that was designed with a business traveler in mind, and which has large conference rooms for business purposes, the wifi signal was very poor and disappeared in most rooms. There is a Starbucks at the hotel (you have to walk outside to get to it) and this is the only semi-cheap breakfast option. However it only has the regular Starbucks fare, with inflated prices, and often has a lineup out the door. When the hotel is at capacity or close to it there are long delays for the elevator. Often it would take 15 minutes just to travel from the lobby up to my room. All things considered it was a good experience at the Hilton but if you're looking for a relaxing/romantic or family vacation I'd reconsider this business-oriented hotel that is often busy and lacks that personal feel of smaller establishments.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton was nice and I will return”
Reviews.Author: airtahoe777
Reviews.Content: Went there on business and really enjoyed it. Great views and just across the street from downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jogom
Reviews.Content: Beautiful scenery and views, great location, top-notch rooms with great bedding and high end toiletries, a helpful friendly staff, and many more positives made this a enjoyable place to stay. We used our HiltonHonors coupons for the $10 (regular price about $22) breakfast buffet (instead of the Starbucks options) and did not realize until checkout that we had coupons for an appetizer at the hotel bar Odysea (would have been nice it that was mentioned to us at check in). It would have been even better if they had a HiltonHonors concierge floor and lounge. Regardless, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: We get to San Diego a couple of times each year and thought we'd try the Hilton Bay front, which turned out to be a great experience. It's new, the rooms are decent sized and typical for this class of Hilton, and they can provide a terrific view of the harbor/waterfront. The check-in/out service was excellent. Parking was expensive, as is the norm for hotels in this part of San Diego, but self-parking was fairly convenient and less costly than valet parking. My wife was presenting at a conference, which was taking place next door at the Convention Center, so convenience was a definite plus. This hotel is next to Petco Field (Padres home), and close to the Gas lamp district, with it's restaurants and other diversions. It's also on the Harbor, which provides access to some really nice walking/running and great people watching. Lots of 'touristy' shops and restaurants in the nearby Harbor Village, which you can get to via a nice walk along the waterfront (lots of boats docked there, etc.). We'll be staying here again when we return to San Diego this October.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton right near Gaslamp District and Petco Park”
Reviews.Author: Ontario315er
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton for 6 nights on a business trip and feel very comfortable recommending it to anyone travelling to San Diego. It was located right on the boardwalk and across the street from Gaslamp District and Petco Park. Room was very clean. I ate the breakfast buffet every morning at Vela (compliments of my employer) and it was very good, but also very expensive at $21...luckily I didn't have to pay. If I have any complaints at all it was because of the housekeeping not replenishing the bathroom soaps and towels. 6 nights and only 1 small bar of soap? Also internet/wifi & parking was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Easily one of the best in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Great property - clean, modern and warm. Great location on the bay with super views and easy access. Our room was comfortable and well appointed - great bathroom and comfortable bed. The location gives you easy walking to Petco Park, Gaslamp, Seaport Village and the Convention Center. The hotel itself has nice amenities and easy parking access. What we liked best is the location and the modern design and amenitiies - it feels elegant and is modern clean while still being very warm and welcoming. Love the Odysea lounge and the selection of SD area microbrews on draft! What we liked least: service. Although all the people we interacted with were pleasant, the service itself was lacking. Let me give you two examples - when we checked in, we had to remind the front desk staff that we had booked a special package through Hilton. This was after they completed the check in process - we had to remind them of our package the benefits. We encountered the same problem on checkout - I had to remind the staff of our package - they just gave us the standard check out which didn't account for our resort credit and parking. Perhaps a minor detail, but why does the customer have to make sure they get the right rate and benefits when they have already been booked/confirmed?
