I just wish they had free wifi, but that's common at large hotel chains these days. What was nice is they offered multiple pricing options for wifi for an hour, and a lower data speed for a cheaper price. Several people at the conference partook in the spa services and said it was lovely! My room was incredibly quiet, and I got a great night's sleep. The beds are clean and comfortable. The rooms were very clean, and trust me I'm picky! If you want a view (I did not), you can pay for the upgrade, otherwise you will be looking at a shipyard.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Posh, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: levd1_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with our baby girl, and must say - loved the location. It is a 2-minute walk away from the Convention Center, 5 minutes away from Petco Park, and a 10-minute walk from Gaslamp. It's a perfect hotel for those who are looking to take in a game and party it up at night, since you don't need to deal with cabs or looking for parking at Gaslamp. Felt a little odd coming back to our hotel room at 10pm when people were just ready to go out and party :) The gym is very nice, and breakfast downstairs was delicious. Parking was $25, which I thought was a rip-off, but you don't have much choice, and they know it. We paid extra to have an ocean view, and didn't regret it - it was nice to wake up and see the Bay with all the cruise ships and military ships every morning. We did not try the spa, but it did look very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: Koni97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large with an air of sophistication. The check in was very quick and friendly, accomodating an early check in. Very nice. The rooms were clean, quiet and the bed was comfortable. The grounds are immaculately kept, with great outdoor balconies overlooking the harbour. The meeting room was large & comfortable. The service during the 3 day meetings was second to none. It is short walking distance to the gaslamp district, everything is right at your fingertips. Definately a good place to stay if you are on an expense account. Of course you are paying for the location. Everthing within the hotel is very expensive and actually, my feeling, slightly out of line for my taste. One would figure that if you shell out that much money for a room, they wouldn't charge $4.95 per bottle of water and $6.00/hr for internet. Even in the business centre, you had to pay for internet. Particularly when the location is right beside the convention centre and there are probably a significant amount of business people staying there. I found the food and drinks expensive as well. It's a short walk to the gaslamp for a break from the prices & a step up in the food. It turned me off, even being on an expense account.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: kristenv1483
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bayfront was a beautiful hotel in a very centralized location. Close to public transit, shopping, and resturants. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The hotel accomidations were nice. Pool was very nice right next to the bay. Would have been nice to have some more beachfront location being it is right on the bay. But was still very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation”
Reviews.Author: Celmed
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice in the last month. Although we live in San Diego we were attending summer events (Symphony Pops and baseball) and decided it would be fun to stay downtown and not have to worry about traffic, parking or drinking and driving. The hotel is chic but friendly and very airy. Happy Hour at the main bar starts at 4:00 with half off drafts, well drinks and appetizers. The regular prices are quite steep ($8.50 for a draft beer) so HH is a good time to go. Plus the bay view and nice atmosphere make for a pleasant way to begin your stay. The taps are local San Diego craft beers -- a nice touch, although perhaps confusing for out-of-towners. Both times our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Our second stay placed us in a Port/Bridge side room on the 12th floor. If you are a light or late sleeper I would avoid this because the Dole boats can be noisy when loading and unloading. I called to inquire about this and the clerk moved us without my even complaining. Since the hotel is large, they do have a good amount of inventory for moving people around. Still, I recommend not chancing it and booking a bayview or cityview room. The bathroom has no tub but does have a luxurious large shower we loved. Towels are big and soft. On our second visit we had bathrobes but not on the first -- not sure why. Nice bath amenities from Crabtree and Evelyn. Large hairdryer in drawer. Room was quiet both times even though the hotel was fairly full. The room doors are heavy and thick, which probably contributes to that. Didn't eat at the main restaurant but did enjoy appetizers and drinks in both the main bar and in the Fox Sports bar downstairs. Service and quality were excellent, plus both are open late. Starbucks downstairs has a lovely outdoor patio. There are many nice places to sit and relax inside and outside the hotel. On our first visit we ordered room service for dinner so we could relax. My husband, who is a steak connoisseur, said his room service steak was the best New York he had ever had. Quite a compliment! Didn't use pool or gym (the gym is indeed free -- I asked) but plan to next time as both looked great. Location allows for a nice walk or run along the bay and easy access to the convention center across the street. The Gaslamp District and Petco Park are just a little jaunt, easily walkable. I like that this Hilton is away from the noise and clutter yet close enough to walk for meals, shopping and entertainment. Really an ideal location for all purposes. The parking garage is easy in and out. When you check in, you inform the front desk that you self-parked and they add the $25/day fee to your account. When you exit the garage you simply hand a voucher to the attendant and off you go! In and out privileges are included. We are pretty picky hotel people who prefer upscale hotels such as the Ritz-Carlton but this property gets the full thumbs-up from both of us. I'm looking forward to many more stays!

Reviews.Title: “New - Modern - Cold - Average - Confrence Friendly”
Reviews.Author: seattlematt1956
Reviews.Content: Very effecient confrnece facility with expense account prices. Upgrad and get a room that does not overlook the roof of a vast confrence facility. Plan on eating elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Has both style and quality”
Reviews.Author: KevandJan
Reviews.Content: The third hotel my wife and I visited on our recent US trip and we were very impressed. We got a corner room with dual aspect windows so had views of both downtown and the bay. Double shower and brand new amenities all of high quality. Very nicely designed with good natural light throughout. Free ipads in the lobby bar were also a nice touch. You can't beat the location which is great for either strolling along the embarcadero or venturing into the Gaslamp district for dinner. We stayed for three nights and didn't need a car. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “IMPROVED SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: NadChicago
Reviews.Content: This was my second time @ this hotel. last time i was there was in nov. 2009 and i was pleased to see that changes for the better have been implemented. For one, the gym is free of charge now. last time i was there they were charging $15 a day. Also, paper @ your door M-F is free now( was 75C before) . and l was pleased to see when i was there that they had two people @ the concierge desk.. used to be just one person and a long line ! the restaurant is still good, breakfast buffet still pricy but decent. rooms are really nice, great bed!!. they only thing i still can not get used to is that the main entrance to the hotel-- hard to access if you are on foot -- entrance is hidden on the side of the hotel, facing a parking structure . but overall it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious sheets,smallish room,nice pool&great service”
Reviews.Author: rozbollvr
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 8 night stay on the bayfront in downtown San Diego -- very close to Gaslamp District; enjoyed the luzurious cotton white sheets and duck down feather pillows. Though rooms were smallish the plugs and phones were adequate for charging,etc. Nice pool and hot tub outside. They also had a Starbucks on the premises that we partook of several mornings for a muffin and coffee before heading out. Also, several other nice restaurant and bar/restaurant choices available in the hotel. The concierge was helpful with recommendations in Coronado and maps. Service always friendly and good. Excellent location. Close to many sites. Close to Coronado bridge. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to a friend. Garage parks up quickly on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern Hilton”
Reviews.Author: joeyjo99
Reviews.Content: One of the newer hotels in the Hilton chain, very modern and huge. Rooms were spotless and nicely done, although it's worth paying a little more ($30?) for an ocean view as my first room overlooked an ugly parking lot! Breakfast expensive but very good, woman in the lower ground floor restaurant rude but nice bar upstairs with views over the water. The location is next to the Convention centre and just across the road from the Gaslamp district with the Hilton Gaslamp hotel immediately opposite the convention centre so just as convenient (a colleague stayed there and rooms and lobby good, smaller than Bayfront which might be better?) , worth considering if their prices are cheaper than at the Bayfront, I'd be happy at either.

Reviews.Title: “For La Cumbre Meeting”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel... Great Location, Bay Views... New Look and Modern. Good Service

Reviews.Title: “You'll have GREAT time if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: Littletrin
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great stay over Labor Day weekend. Went with our twin 5 year old boys. Got a great rate on sandiego.com, buy 2 nights get 3rd night free for $149 a night. Which I thought was a good deal esp at last minute. Did our research so we knew to expect high parking fees. $25 to self park. But the free night made it still seem like a good deal and offset the parking charge. We also knew about the wifi charge. We paid it, but in the future we should just go to a free wifi cafe. We were lazy. The view from our window was EXCELLENT for our boys. 24th floor. They got to see the train/trolley yards, the shipping dock with a load of Dole bananas being put on a huge cargo ship, the bridge and water with sailboats. The boys set their toys up on the window ledge and played and played. Room size was just fine for us, we don't need a huge room to mess up. 2 queen beds. Beds were very comfy and furniture and bathroom seemed new and in good condition. I like that they supplied a BIG blowdryer. Pool was great for our boys since it isnt super deep and they could really swim around. Lots of families so we didnt feel like we were disrupting a "singles scene". The location of the hotel on the bay was SO great for us. The boys could RUN and RUN and RUN down the pier length or in front of the convention center. Then just a short walk to Gaslamp area. We had no trouble getting good reasonable food close by with no waiting. There were many good family choices. Broken Yolk for breakfast. Tin Fish was great casual place for our loud family. At night the Hilton lights this big pit fire outside near the water, and there were comfy couches to sit on. It is probably meant to be a lounge-scene, but no one was there when we walked by so we had a nice end to the night, just watching the flames and enjoying the bayfront breeze and lights. The Hilton also was showing Shrek one night and Avatar the next night on the HUGE screen tv outside by the pool. It was free and they also served free sodas and popcorn. I thought that was a cool idea. Didnt bother using the gym (supposedly there is also a charge for that). The long pier is right outside and perfect for a morning run. Lots of people around and it felt safe. So, if you know what to expect, you can avoid being nickel and dimed. I thought it was a really terrific place and value. Will def go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location, not impressive service”
Reviews.Author: anglerjess
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful location, rooms and ambiance. In fact, one of the best nights sleeps I've ever had. SUPER cozy beds and airy rooms! Lost me at the service. Room service, front desk and housekeeping were all very polite and welcoming. However, on our way back from the beach, we called and asked if the bar at the hotel wsa going to have the local football game on. They assured us yes. When we arrived to watch the game, they wouldn't turn the sound on. Every single person in the bar was trying to watch the game, however they wouldnt' turn the sound on. They said the chef didnt' approve of it, and it ruined the feeling of his restaurant and bar. So much for guest satisfaction. So they told us to check out the pool bar. They had music on as well, and the sun hit the small screens that played the game, so no luck. We went back to the restaurant, and watched the game and read the subtitles. However, the wait staff gave us the short end of the stick once they saw we were back. Our food came out wrong twice, and I even witnessed our server mocking us to another server. Very rude and unprofessional. I recommend the hotel overall, but there are some things that need to be adjusted.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mizmof
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Bayfront for 3 nights while in San Diego for a family wedding. The hotel's location is good and the views from our room on 19th floor were amazing BUT, I have to agree with another reviewer that you do feel like your nickle and dimed for everything. We paid $199/night plus $25 self parking(pretty easy, don't bother w/ valet) but there was NOTHING complimentary. Wi-fi is $14.95 for 24 hours, bottle water in room is $4.50, no fridge. Also the on-line pictures of pool area look real nice because it's empty..wait 'til you go there and see all the blue towels draped over the beach chairs and empty cups littered around pool deck. I was never able to get a lounge chair and found the dirty dishes, empty drink cups, straws and bottles strewn on the trays to save a spot pretty disgusting. The Fox Grill restaurant food was mediocre but the Vela restaurant had a great breakfast buffet for $21.95.....and yes, that is per person. I only utilized the concierge once and found her to be apathetic. ....Overall, a swanky looking hotel that I would recommend based on location only but if you're looking for a good deal, this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the bay”
Reviews.Author: DMallyon
Reviews.Content: Large hotel -- excellent location, excellent spa, but pricey if you just want to use the gym. Didn't eat at the restaurants, but the conference catering was well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with average service”
Reviews.Author: tempetravelgal
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again just based on location and price. Got a decent rate for two nights over July 4th weekend. Parking is extra. Facilities are nice and clean. Walking distance to Petco Park which was great for us since we went to a game. Concierge and other staff seemed apathetic...almost annoyed with simple requests such as where to find pizza, or how to get certain places using the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather_and_Jon
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at this hotle and loved every minute. Had booked into another hotel in San Diaego months in advance but on arrival didn't like it so moved to the Hilton. The location is great and really accessible for the city centre. Upgraded to an ocean view which was worth it. The room was spotless and really attractive and comfortable. Our children (10 and 12) loved the pool and far from being charged were given free drinks and snacks. Yes, the parking charge is a bit steep but very convenient and secure. Ate in the Vela restaurant twice and thought the food was fantastic and the service wonderful. The bar area is lovely and sitting outside watching the sunset was fabulous. There was a convention going on but that did not impact on our stay at all (over 2,000 delegates) and it was fascinating watching the hotel set up outside dining for them. Overall, great experience and loved San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Glawen_10
Reviews.Content: Hi, usually Hilton are a good choice when i'm travelling for business. The Hilton Bayfront surprised me for several reasons: - The cost of additional services: you have to pay to get in to the fitness center or to the pool (this is really unusual) - I haven't got room service for two days! And they just said me "ok, sorry!" ... this is not what you expect from a 4 stars ... There are better hotels in the neighbours

Reviews.Title: “prepare to be nickeled-and-dimed”
Reviews.Author: caro97
Reviews.Content: the hilton presents itself as a top hotel, but once you take the bait, it reveals itself to be another one of these petty chain businesses that tries to wring a few more dollars from you at every opportunity. did you choose the hotel because the fitness center sounded good? well, you will have to pay to get inside it, even though you are a guest of the hotel. want to connect to the internet? get your wallet out. it took me a while to learn to avoid these places but i will definitely do my homework going forward!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is trying too hard to be cool”
Reviews.Author: kuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my GF on part of Our California tour on June 2010. Pros: + Good location near the Gaslamp Quarter. + Nice view from the room. + Greak breakfast at the Vela and the view was great too. + Easy self-parking. + After a long discussion get free upgrade, free breakfast and Starbucks drinks. Cons: - Check-in takes forever - Why there’s only soap at the bathroom? - Pool area tries to be hot spot, but it is not. - Staff don’t appreciate your diamond status. - Bed was quite hard to sleep. Overall nice one night stay. I’d propably give Hilton a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: JMS-SD
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for the night of my engagement. I had been to the hotel before but never as a guest. Every aspect of our stay was fantastic. From the front desk staff to the modern rooms to the outlets , everything was first class. We had a couple's message at Spa Aquazul and the staff went above and beyond to make a special day for us even better. I can' think of a better hotel experience and hope to stay again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hilton Bayfront. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tchoiniere
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Hilton Bayfront. Got a great rate for it. Really enjoyed the hotel. Room was on the 29th floor overlooking Petco Park and the Coronado Bridge. Lobby is big and spread out. Can be a little confusing to find stuff especially if there are a lot of people milling about. However, I found that the staff was always willing to help answer questions. Parking in the garage was easy and quick except on game nights. It was a short walk to the Gaslamp but not a straight shot as you had to go around the trolley tracks. They are building a pedestrian bridge which will be great. I got a great rate through work so was very happy with that. I would definitely stay here again but fear that the prices will jump quickly. My only complaints with the hotel were: 1) they had a massive convention going on and it was tough to get an elevator, waited up to 20 minutes at times. Not much the hotel can do but you should be aware of this. 2) All beers at the hotel bar were $8.00 except during Happy Hour. Little too expensive. Also, sodas from the machines were $3.50. 3) Parking was $25 for self parking (Typical for any downtown hotel). Garage is next door to the hotel. However, it is also used for game traffic and can get very busy before games. Just be aware of that, But service at the hotel was very good and enjoyable. I got free buffet coupons for breakfast every morning which worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views and relaxing decor. This Hilton is awesome”
Reviews.Author: leasesd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for my birthday. The view from our room of the bay was majestic. I just sat looking out the window in awe at such a beautiful city San Diego is. The hotel is within walking distance to the convention center and the San Diego Padres baseball field, Petco Park. I was here however to ride sea doos that are rented at the marina in sea port village. The Hilton is decorated in warm browns and crisp blues. It is classy and comfortable all at the same time. We had dinner at the fox sports grill and watched the Padres down the Dodgers. The Fox grill is fun and there isn't a bad view in the house. On the patio, be sure to pull up a chair outside and relax by the warm glow of the fire rings while you watch the twinkling lights of Coronado Island.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Bayfront for SD Comic Con Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TwstdTravlr
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront for the SD Comic Con '10 and it was Fantastic! The hotel is what I would describe as simplistic, very modern, lots of open areas throughout the lobby and promenade area. We enjoyed having cocktails in the lounge where you can sit with large groups or by yourself in very comfortable/cushy chairs inside or outside. The Fox Grill Restaurant has delicious food, but the cocktails were not so "alcoholly", had to send mine back to get "strengthened". Bed was great, view was great, walk to Convention Center was short. Starbucks outside the hotel but not a problem to get to. The Staff although a little standoffish were friendly, and when we asked for extra towels boy did we get them! There were celebrities staying at the hotel and a few parties along with some Comic Con Panels other days. Spa was wonderful. Enjoyed this hotel and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice new hotel close to the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: The Hilton sits right next to the Convention Center, on the bay as the name alludes, and a short walk to the Gaslamp District. The hotel is fairly new (maybe one year old) and is modern and sleek. The lobby is subdued and classy. There is a parking garage next to the hotel or you can use valet … both options are not cheap. The rooms are new, clean and comfortable but nothing outstanding. The bathroom was small and old style (i.e. tub / shower combo). The pool area is very nice, overlooking the bay front, with warm salt water and plenty of lounge chairs. The restaurant Vela was good for breakfast, probably not worth the price (with the HH Diamond benefits it was still $10 and maybe $22 without). The bar Odysea was nice and hopping on Friday evening. There was a Starbucks on premises which was good for a quick breakfast. This is a good place to stay if you are attending a convention at the nearby center or want to be walking distance to the Gaslamp but not in the Gaslamp. The place is new and clean and worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Air tight concrete”
Reviews.Author: DVP16
Reviews.Content: The good. Nice newer property, staff is friendly, good customer service. The down side is the rooms are a bit small for a new property. The property is concrete and steel with sealed shut windows so although it is on the bay you get to breathe the same stale air inside the hotel. Hallways are already starting to smell musty. At minimum hotels should put windows in that have a vent of some sort for those of us that like a bit of fresh air? Easy parking in the garage that has a walkway to it. Skip the valet parking. Short walk to convention centre (10 minutes) about 15-20 to the gas lamp area where all the restaurants are. But to get to the gas lamp you have to go down the street a bit to a crosswalk and sometimes have to wait for trains to go by. They are building a walkway closer to the hotel but it is not completed. There is a sports bar on the lowest level on the bay front but you have to go outside the hotel to get to it, same with Starbucks, have to go out to get to it. The hotel restaurant was dead most of the time as the prices are the usual Hilton “you have got to be kidding” prices, wait staff needs some training on customer service and seem to disappear for extended periods. Room service prices are again a bit high but that is what you get when you stay at a Hilton. If you ship anything to or from the hotel for an event be prepared for the usual gouging from them for looking at your package. Suggesting shipping off site. Even the UPS store on the property slaps on a hotel fee.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and good location”
Reviews.Author: DD10_10
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and location, close to the gaslamp area.

Reviews.Title: “Bayfront Gem”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple89
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several Hiltons this one has to rank among the highest. The views of downtown San Diego or the cornando bridge are great. depending on which room you can even seen the ball park. The Hotel is very big. parking is easy to get in and out. Rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The fox sports grill downstairs has some delicous burgers to chow down on. Check in and check out is a breeze. TWO THUMBS for this place.

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: marre5
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention and chose this hotel because I mistakenly thought it was one I had stayed in previously (No, that was the Marriott, where you should stay!). First of all, it's a little bit more of a walk - to the convention center, to Gaslamp Quarter, and to the restaurants and shops on the Embarcadero. The decor is very modern with clean lines and the room was adequate. Here's what really bugged me: the hotel charged $15/shot to use the gym, which wasn't any great shakes; they charged for internet usage in the business center; and get this, the little pool in the back is opposite a giant Dole container unloading site - imagine the noise. I was reduced to sneaking down the boardwalk into the Marriott's lovely tranquil pool area. All in all, not much value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: ilikecows13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights in early June 2010. It was not a bad place to stay. Our biggest problem was the costs of staying there, which made the other stuff that was not up to Hilton standards seem even more frustrating. First the bad stuff: We used Hhonors points, so our stay could be free. We were trying to save for other activities--like dining out and going site seeing. We did do a room upgrade and paid 40 dollars for that. As beautiful as the view in the room was, most other hotels we've been to have been willing to upgrade for free when you tell them you are there on a romantic getaway. On top of that, everything necessary was ridiculously expensive. We paid 20 bucks a day for parking and 20 bucks a day for high speed "premium" internet access. We did watch one movie for 15 bucks on pay-per-view one of the nights. Our final bill when we checked out came to 170 bucks, even though we were supposedly getting a "free" stay. The decor of the place was not inviting--it was rather intimidating, actually. The lobby felt like the lobby of a hospital. Almost everyone who was staying there with us seemed younger than us (I'm 28--my husband 39). All the older folks seemed a little put off by all the contemporary design as well. I get the feeling that they will have to renovate soon because the style of the place is very *now*. One thing made my husband and I a little ill was the strong odor of sewage coming from who-knows-where as we walked down the hall to our room every night. I don't know if someone had a serious case of the stomach flu, or if we were located next to some sewage pipe. Regardless, it was definitely more than a little rank and we were always nearly knocked off our feet by it. We never complained to the management, though. One not so significant issue was that the consierge was away from her desk more often than not. But there was plenty to the good side of the whole experience as well. We did have to take a short walk to get to the gaslamp district, but it was well worth it. LOVED it there. Balboa park and all the museums didn't take long to get to by car. We highly recommend Donovan's Steakhouse. As mentioned before, prices aside, the room's view was really spectacular. Coronado bridge and island were beautiful sights at night. Other hotel guests have complained of noise, but this was not a problem for us. We slept through the night with no problems. We were located on the ocean-side of the hotel, though. All in all, we did enjoy our time here, but the time we enjoyed was not as much in the hotel as around SanDiego.

Reviews.Title: “Add ons, Add ons . . . really add up”
Reviews.Author: LorraineSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Internet accessis $13.95 or 19.95 per day. Fitness Center is $15 per day. Room service is hit or miss. Skip the spherical pancakes, but the Farmer's soup was amazing. Really disappointed by the lack of details (non working coffee maker, houskeeper failed to change the ice bucket, non-organic fruit in fitness center). Here's a tip to hotel management, if I am willing to spen $15 to workout, then I'm not eating pesticide ridden fruit. Just a thought. Room is gorgeous and spacious. Views of the bay are nice. Location is perfect - close to everything, but quiet. I would stay here again, but I prefer to be charged the right price and have the amenities included in my stay. Less annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, a little isolated”
Reviews.Author: ocInvestor2
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful well maintained hotel with nice rooms. The staff is professional, but a bit cool. It has a nice view, but it is at the end of the convention center district and bit of a schlepp walk to the Gaslamp - or anything else. They are building a pedestrian overpass that will connect the hotel to Petco park which stood help with this problem. Also, there is no breakfast for HHonors elites, they give you a coupon for the Starbucks on the ground level. In addition to the Starbucks, there is also a Fox Sports Grill on the property. There are several restaurants that are part of the Hotel, but I ate at a catered dinner in one of the ballrooms and it was so bad, I have never again braved the food prepared by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jt7dreamz
Reviews.Content: stayed here during the san diego half marathon. perfect location given that the convention center was close and there were buses/shuttles to the location of the start. close to the zoo and gas lamp district. concierge was very helpful. pros: great bed, friendly service, great shower/pressure/toiletries cons: large feeling hotel would def return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Ipoxy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got a great location and the quality of this new hotel is impecable. The hotel is sited right on the bayside, and if you get a room on the right side you get great views over both downtown, bay, petco park, and gaslamp quarter. The quality of the room are as mentioned excellent but the room are small compared to the price you pay. The pool area is an excellent place for relaxing and the restaurants connected to the hotel has both great service and great taste. What i found a bit negative is that they charge extra for several cost, like using the internet and breakfast. They offer different internet connection varying from normal speed to high speed connections. I don't understand how a accknowledge hotel as hilton don't offter the normal speed line free of use. Not sure I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: mrsslk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, nicely appointed (although kindof basic), and comfortable. Best of all, it is located on the water and within walking distance to the Gaslamp district. It's also easy to get to Coronado Island from the hotel. We had an awesome view of the waterfront and of the city. We got a really good price through Expedia. Downsides - don't like the charge for the internet and you have to pay for parking (common in a downtown hotel). Our stay was very pleasant, service was excellent, and especially liked having Starbucks right there in the hotel. Also tried the Fox Sports Bar and Grill and found it reasonably priced and very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice for Young Couples”
Reviews.Author: Dpaige17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had free flights to San Diego so we were primarily looking for a reasonably priced hotel since it was such a last-minute trip. We booked the Hilton Bayfront because we found a good deal online and were pleasantly surprised to find that we experienced just as much luxury and ambience (if not more) than other hotels nearby with higher prices. The perks were the hotel's proximity to the trolley, Petco Park, the marina and the Gaslamp District. We rented a convertible at the airport so that we could sightsee at our own pace. It was extremely convenient that we could drop our rental car right off at the Hilton Bayfront's Hertz counter. This was a great way to save on parking since I heard it was pretty expensive. Our favorite part of the room was the beds... we slept so well during our stay! The Hilton Bayfront is a great spot for young couples who want to experience luxury while vacationing, but don't want to spend an arm and a leg doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: couturegal0818
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hilton bayfront just two days and 1night and it was enough to win me the hotel is amazing with a beautiful pool and the staff A++ check in was a breeze and we asked for a later check out and being that the hotel was pretty busy they were able to accomodate us.The fox sports grill located in the hotel was such a good restaurant to eat the service there is the best.This being my 1st trip to san diego was such a great experience this hilton seems to cater to those that want to go relax and undwind.The only down side that i noticed was that there were no mini bars in the room but that was just a minor detail.All in all the hotel is beautiful and i will definetly be going back to it on my next trips to san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bbadger_10
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a 4-night stay at this hotel while attending a convention. I was very impressed. The hotel is in walking distance to the convention center, but far enough away from all the hype from the Gaslamp Quarter so I could get a good night's rest. Some of my girlfriends stayed in the Gaslamp Quarter, and they were awaken all night from the noise on 5th Ave. and the train that runs right through there. I've read other reviews about the hotel Starbucks being inconveniently located outside of the hotel. I did not find this to be a problem at all. The Starbucks is right on your way to the convention center. No big deal. The rooms were also very clean. Being a Hilton Honors member I was upgraded to a room with the a beautiful view of the marina. I also received free access to the fitness center and steam room, which they both were very nice. Loved the cucumber water and cucumber slices for your eyes in the steam room. Very refreshing the morning after a night out! I guess if I had to point out a negative, it would be that the service at the front desk seemed slow. Then again, there were a lot of people checking in and out during this convention. It really wasn't a big deal, but if I had to say something, that would be it. Overall, very clean, modern and great hotel. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kperna1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, service was excellent and they have a great spa. Good time to relax while at a business conference.

Reviews.Title: “More of the same sterile corporate decor...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to delineate all of these 4-star hotels...the lobbies are just different variations of the same style of decor, the rooms all blend together in my memory, and they all ream you on parking (here it's about $25/night). So, my ratings reflect just those things that pop out. I used Priceline once again...I'm a local and it's the only way I stay in the Gaslamp since I know there is an abundance of rooms in 4-star hotels (as long as Comic Con or a holiday is not happening). I got the two beds per room as I requested, but no adjoining rooms were available. They treated me respectably considering I only paid $95 per room for two rooms....sometimes that's not the case with hotels and their Priceline customers. The reason for the 3-stars is because of specific location and overall feel. Yes, the hotel has great views, but location is a lot more important to me since I don't spend a lot of time in my room...and, when I'm in it, I'm not spending a lot of time gazing out the window. It's just outside of the Gaslamp district, across and a ways up Harbor Drive...a taxi is required to get to all the restaurants and clubs. Unless you're a maniac. When you've got 6 women, that adds to the overall cost. Also, the place just felt deserted...even of staff...and a bit cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great views, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: NancyKayAzusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days for our anniversary. Had a corner room on the 24th floor and the views out of each window were gorgeous! The bed was amazing! Loved everything about this hotel, but we really needed to find restaurants in the gas lamp district. Fox Sports grill was good the first time or two, after that we took a "pedi-cab" and had dinner elsewhere. All in all would stay here anytime of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern, and oh so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: PRexec
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a recent business trip and couldn't have been happier with the accommodations at the Hilton Bayfront. The hotel is brand new and beautifully designed with sleek, modern Euro-type decor-- lots of light wood, chrome, modern artwork, etc. If you're looking for small and cozy this is definitely not the place, but if you're looking for a really hopping yet extremely comfortable hotel with all the amenities in a great part of town, I'd say go for it. Our room was on the 26th floor with an absolutely gorgeous view of the city and harbor. The large, sunny window made the room seem much larger than it was, and at the end of a busy day-- it was a light and airy place to come home to. Very, very quiet and relaxing! Everything you might need is right at your fingertips including a Starbucks on the premises and a terrific business center. The bed was amazingly comfortable and although the windows didn't open, the thermostat could be easily adjusted for perfect sleeping temperatures. There weren't bathrobes in the room, but when I called the front desk and asked for them, housekeeping delivered complimentary robes within 5 minutes. Perhaps one of the nicest features of the hotel was its proximity to the water. Right out your door literally were walking, jogging, biking paths along the waterfront and two lovely seaside parks. Restaurants were a stones' throw away, both along the water and in the bustling Gaslamp area a block away. All in all, I have nothing but praise for this new San Diego hotel and would highly recommend it for business and/or pleasure traveling. It's a light, bright, gorgeously modern place with friendly staff and all the comforts of home. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: ray2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights for a conference. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and clean. I had a nice water view overlooking the convention center. There was a wedding on the grass below on one day. The pool looked pretty nice but I didn't partake. They don't have a breakfast so instead they offer coupons to Starbucks for HHonors members. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to the main part of the convention center. It is probably a little further than the Hilton Gaslamp. A friend of mine stayed there and I saw his room - the Bay Front rooms were larger than those of the Gas Lamp. He told me the train was pretty loud at his room. I didn't notice the train at all during my stay. One thing that seemed confusing was where to go for parking. I could see the garage but it wasn't obvious to me how to get in. It didn't matter to me since I was dropped off. Walking to the convention center seemed easiest when walking out from the very bottom floor rather than from the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i have ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aimjosh
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this hotel is it is by far the best place I have ever stayed at. When I first checked in the front desk agent was very helpful and nice. The room was amazing, and for that the entire hotel was amazing. I will def recommend this place to friends and family. And the location of this hotel is amazing, right next to the gaslamp area for food and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: handsomehunk
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite impressive but service lagged at time. The room service is not available late and delivery service was not impressive at all. Overall the stay was OK but it could have been better with the better service. Proximity to gas lamp makes it three stars instead of two.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: CBTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights during a conference. Positives: 1. Rooms quiet and relatively comfortable (but on the smallish side) 2. Nice views from some rooms 3. If attending a conference at convention center, it is next door Negatives 1. There is a Starbucks in the building, but is hard to find. You actually have to go outside and around to the side to get to it 2. They charge a fee to use the gym 3. Service is restaurants is sssssllllllloooooowwwww 4. Lighting is somewhat stark in common areas Bottom line: I would not go out of my way to stay there again. On the other hand, it attending a conference and this was the conference hotel, would probably book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Hilton Honors Treatment”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler155
Reviews.Content: I was not at all happy with the Bayfront. The lobby is difficult, too spread out. It is like walking around an airport : ( I am diamond level with Hilton, and I opt for breakfast as my perk. I was given two Starbucks vouchers, one for a drink and one for a food item. To get to Starbucks, I had to go downstairs from the lobby, out the door and around the corner. When I stay at a hotel, I want to be pampered not sent downstairs, outside and around the corner. How cheap can Hilton get?! The staff was less than welcoming. The only thing the staff did with any consistency was stick their hands out for a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Blood Stains, Mildew, and Dirty bed sheets!”
Reviews.Author: jonniewalker
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and I cam here for a conferece. When I went in the the shower curtains had blood stains on them(GROSSE) and then the second room had Mildew stains on the tub. Then the third room the bed sheets were dirty. For a 4 star hotel the cleaniness was disgusting. I dont know why anyone would want to stay there. I would not stay there again. I will tell you that....BLOOD STAINS.

Reviews.Title: “Great view over the harbor from this Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: traveler5125
Reviews.Content: ...if you can get a room with a view. The rate for a room with a view is higher than one without. The hotel is pretty standard, everything is nice. I had a pretty nice view even though I didn't get a room with a view. The lobby is "modern" decor and so not really cozy, warm and inviting, but it's pretty nice. The location is great, walking distance to a lot of places to eat as well as the harbor, Sea Port Village (a place where you can buy a lot of souvenirs take a scenic walk etc). There is both valet and self parking both are pretty pricey $22 and $32 respectively, but at based on the location self parking is not out of line with other similar areas. Like most high end hotels nothing is free: every little thing is itemized.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but they charge for everything”
Reviews.Author: WAhiker
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms to be nice and overall quit. However, everything cost extra which always bothers me. Parking was over $20, internet was expensive, the exercise room cost extra, ... I don't know why large, expensive hotels frequently charge for everything while medium grade hotels provide services for free. I will not stay here because I really don't like adding all the extra expense to a motel stay so I just end up not exercising, not using the internet, etc. Overall the place was clean and quiet however. I would rate it as average accommodation for it's price range assuming they didn't charge additionally for every service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views with a great central location!”
Reviews.Author: captJose82
Reviews.Content: about 1/2 mile from the Gaslamp Quarter and across the street from Petco Park (for baseball fans). Plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance and right next door to the convention center. Great fitness center. Pretty good restaurants on premises. Self parking is $21 a night.

Reviews.Title: “They do it right.”
Reviews.Author: patio53
Reviews.Content: I am sorry that previous reviewers did not care for this hotel. I was impressed from the minute we stepped out of the car. Actually, before that as we had to call for directions. They even did that well. The bell staff was courteous and cheerful. They explained all the options for parking, as well as the prices. And, they did it without making us feel inferior for choosing the cheaper option. The reception staff was competent and quick. A large convention was checking in and them seemed to have staffed accordingly. The room was excellent. You couldn't host a party in it, but it had all the amenities. The beds were comfortable with good linens. The bath towels were fluffy and plentiful. You can hear doors close, but the room doesn't shake. You aren't awakened by conversations in other rooms or people walking overhead. You don't hear people talking in the halls or taking showers. Rooms were cleaned in a timely fashion, but you never felt pushed out. Departure was handled with the same efficiency and the bill was accurate. I thought the location was convenient to the convention center, the Gaslight district, Petco Field and the streetcar line. The streetcar line gets you easily around San Diego. An all day pass is $5. From the hotel you can walk/run along the waterfront to connect with Seaport Village and other waterfront hotels. I only ate reception food at the hotel, so I can't comment on the hotel dining optionst, but there a lots of dining options close to the hotel up 5th St. or in Seaport Village. The Starbucks was practically inaccessible, but you could get regular coffee and pastry at a cart in the lobby. I was really impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but slightly isolating”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrierMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight on business. I like the bayfront area of San Diego, thought I'd check this place out. The hotel is modern, clean, and spacious. It seems to me its trying to create a "Miami" vibe with the decor and music in the common areas. It's next to the Convention Center and close to Petco Park. One thing I didn't realize until I was there was that, although its on the bayfront, you have to walk about a quarter mile through a large unlit parking lot behind the convention center to get to the other shops and restaurants on the bayfront. This didn't bother me, but I might be concerned if I was a out late at night returning by myself. The room was standard new Hiton, a little small. Fitness center has a lot of stairmasters & treadmills, but not much in the way of other equipment. The pool looked pleasant, a lot of chairs, but overlooks a cargo ship port of the bay, so if a ships in port there's a fair amount of noise. Overall the hotel was fine, but next time I'd probably stay at one of the other hotels on the bayfront.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Cold & Concrete”
Reviews.Author: ron_tw
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Bayside decor reminds me of a high class hospital. Only the food & beverage didn't compare both outstanding quality but at a very high price. If you are going to the San Diego convention center you can consider this hotel for its convenient location....but only in the boss is paying!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Darlenewrice
Reviews.Content: Beautiful scenery and 1st class hotel. Able to see the bay from my room. We had lunch prepared by the hotel on the grounds. The lunch was excellent. The night time entertainment was great too.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hppygilmore
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Bayfront and we love it each time. We will be back for a 4th stay in March. The hotel is new and well taken care of. the staff is friendly and the beds are comfortable. The rooms are standard size but are nicely furnished. If you get a bay view it is spectacular. The only negative is parking is about $21 per day. The pool is saltwater and is always warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, But Customer Service Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: cmeekins
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about my stay at this new hotel. It was my birthday weekend & I wanted to "spa" & simply relax. ISSUE #1: On Friday evening, I called the spa to make reservations for the following day. I wanted the works (e.g. 80 minute deep tissue, oxygen infusion facial, & foot reflexology). Stephanie answered the phone & asked if I would mind being placed on a "brief" hold. I said, "no problem". So, I waited, & waited, & waited, & waited, & waited until I realized she was NOT going to return to the phone..........& she didn't. Very poor customer service. Unforgivable. My anger was fueled by their Gratuity policy. A gratuity is EARNED not automatically given. It is a privilege that I & I the consumer, ALONE should make. Not the hotel. The thought of Stephanie receiving any portion of my gratuity prevented me from calling back. I simply could not accept the thought. And needless to say, my "Spa Day" was ruined, hence so was my weekend. ISSUE #2: On Saturday, I went to have breakfast at Vela and was promptly seated by the hostess & was informed that someone would be there to assist me. Great! I looked at the menu & was ready to order w/i minutes. There was one waiter that whisked by me several times making eye contact with me. I assumed he would be assisting me since he was assisting everyone else in that area. NO. So, again I waited and waited, & no one ever came. Another hostess seated guests behind me & w/i minutes a different waiter walked over to them & immediately took their order. I happened to see the hostess who seated me & questioned the situation. The waiter at the other table happened to be MINE as well. Extremely frustrating. ISSUE #3: Hair in the complimentary room coffee cup. ISSUE #4: The hallways needed to be vacuumed. I do LOVE the modernism of the hotel and the views, location, etc..........but how great can this jewel be if the foundation is weak? I hope they get it together. I would love to visit it again since I always stay at the Machester Grand Hyatt. Oh, and the Fitness Center charges a $15/day fee. The king size bed was was not so comfortable. I guess I didn't have one of those serendity beds.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, clean and great beds....”
Reviews.Author: aszurh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for one night with my mother who was visiting the area. Great location to walk around the Gas Lamp district and tons of shops/restaurants. The hotel is directly on the water so there is a bit of a breeze but great views of Mission Bay. Plenty of options in the hotel for food, drinks, coffee (Starbucks) and gym. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: MillerCorona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in early December. We got the stay 2 nights get 1 free and paid for our 4th night. Overall we paid about 100/night for the room. As a Hilton Diamond member we got upgraded to the 19th floor looking the Bay and Downtown. The rooms are new. a bit small, but elegant and plush. The bathroom is standard (nothing too fancy). You can hear the ships, jets (naval base) from the rooms so some mornings are quite loud - however, our family that stayed at the Hyatt had the same problem - so it’s just an issue if you are staying at a hotel by the water. The lobby of the hotel is impressive and very modern. It was all decorated with Christmas ornaments which gave it a nice touch. Normally, as a diamond member one gets free continental breakfast (well usually just breakfast at the executive lounge but they didn't have one) so you got the choice of one drink and item at starbucks or 10 off the breakfast buffet they offer (which is normally 22 per person). I was a bit disappointed with this as I've stayed in Paris and London and gotten beautiful breakfasts complimentary (and drinks and appetizers at happy hour). The vouchers for the starbucks can be used at any time of the day and also you can get 2 drinks (if you don’t get the 1 food item) and vice versa which is kind of nice. We in the end opted for the breakfast buffet and then paid 12 per person. It is a nice buffet overall with lots of selection. We had drinks at their bar in the lobby which was nice - you also get free vouchers for a food item and when we got there it was for chips and salsa. A bit disappointed in this too - if this place had an executive lounge the happy hour would have had more food available complimentary and drinks. The parking is also outrageous (cost more per day than my rental car). Overall the stay was good - i liked that it was a brand new hotel, we had a nice room. I felt nickled and dimed for many things that are normally complimentary for diamond members - so I was a bit peeved at that. But the location was good - a bit of center from downtown but not a far walk at all. I would consider staying here again but would like the see them offer the correct Hilton honour perks that so many other Hiltons do.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: laughli7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights with my husband and infant son. Hotel is beautiful and staff was helpful and friendly. My husband was attending a conference and while he was working during the day my son and went exploring. This hotel has a perfect location! Beautiful views of the water (you can walk right out along the water from the hotel). Across the street from the baseball stadium, and a 5 min walk to the gas lamp district with great restaurants and shopping. We drove to the zoo one day and it was an easy 10 min drive. I defintely recommend this hotel, it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want to do, within walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: propredicr
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to San Diego in a long time. The Bayfront Area has grown up. The Hilton represents this new change and is perfectly located. I had a nice view of the water and the room was very quiet/clean/convenient. We were in meetings all day, but, the hotel was very well taken care of. I never had to wait too long for the elevator or taxi. The only negative was that the food was not as good as some of the other chain hotels. You really don't have to rent a car or take a taxi if you feel like walking. Everything is close by and safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MEMSouthernCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bayfront for the Thanksgiving Day weekend. I was surprised to receive an upgrade to a double queen room (2652). It was a corner northwest room with a spectacular view of the city and the bay! The rain-covered streets and streetlights were breathtakingly holiday inspired. I had dinner at Vela and the atmosphere was fantastic, the fare was just average. The pool and spa are great! V, a female barkeep, was exceptional. Be sure to visit the Odysea Lounge for happy hour (4-6 and 10-12). My second visit was over the Christmas holiday weekend. This time I rec'd a Coronado Bridge/Bay View king room (1002). Although the view was less spectacular than my previous visit, I was still pleased. There was a glass encased shower bath and a convertible sofa in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: attygirl_10
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel...nice and modern. The pool area is really nice as well. The view from our room (1033) was fabulous- bay and city. I am surprised a previous poster stated that the location is out of the way because it is a FANTASTIC location. Right across the street from the convention center and Petco Park, as well as the Gas Lamp District, which is a very quick walk...and I was pushing a big stroller! We walked all around Gas Lamp, and even walked to Horton Plaza easily. It is also a lovely walk along the water to Seaport Village. Another plus is that the room rates are very inexpensive. On the negative side, I agree with a previous poster that nothing here is complimentary, but perhaps that is because the room rates are really low.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views!”
Reviews.Author: GalViolet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early January. We stayed in an upper floor (8th) bay/city view for a fantastic price. Check out their website for the various deals--we used AAA and opted for an upgrade if available for an extra $15. When we arrived we learned we got the upgrade....a larger corner room which gave us a spectacular view of the Coronado Bridge on one side and the seaport/Gaslight area on the other. The room was clean...the beds were comfortable--even if they were doubles rather than queens--I didn't think they made doubles anymore. We ate in the sports grill restaurant at night....the outside propane fires attracted us!--it was a bit odd to have to go outside downstairs in order to get to it. There was no inside entrance from the hotel. (I don't think they thought out the plan too well when designing it). the food was good, even though the service was slooooowwww.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: AltaPat
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton Bayfront Hotel from December 24 to December 31, 2010 turned out to be a great choice.  Our room was very clean, comfortable and had all the amenities you could think of except for a fridge, which we were able to rent for $25.00 for the entire visit. There were blackout drapes (a good thing since we faced southeast) and the room was exceptionally quiet. Pictures of the room/bathroom are attached so that you can see how nice everything was and so that I don't have to mention every little thing that was in the room.  There are already a lot of pictures of the lobby/grounds so I didn't bother taking more - everything is beautiful and there is even a Starbucks downstairs. All the staff that we spoke to from front desk reception, service/housekeeping and concierge were pleasant and willing to help. The rate at the time of $80.00 plus tax per night was a real bargain. We would stay here again in a minute and the only thing that even slightly irritated me was that the body lotion they provide was in this small hard bottle (the lotion was thick and the opening tiny) so it was difficult getting the lotion out, but this is so insignificant I shouldn't even mention it :-). We didn't use the wireless internet, go to the business center or eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel so I can't comment on them.  There are so many interesting restaurants in the Gaslamp District and other areas we visited.  In particular we liked the Tin Fish close to the hotel, Filippis Pizza Grotto in Little Italy, The Crest Cafe in Hillcrest and especially Kansas City Barbeque near the Seaport Village.  A car isn't necessary to get around as the San Diego trolley/bus system is so efficient and the trolley stop is about a 7 minute walk from the hotel.  We were able to get to Balboa Park, Las Americas Outlet Mall in San Ysidro, Hillcrest and even La Jolla by trolley or bus or a combination of both.  Coronado Island can be reached by ferry or bus and makes a nice day trip, especially to see the old Hotel Del Coronado.  If you like to walk, it's easy to go to Seaport Village, Little Italy or to the USS Midway.  For your first day, I would recommend taking the Old Town Trolley Tour (which you can pick up right at the hotel) so as to get a good overview of the area and to help you decide what you would like to explore most.  Old Town, with its historic walking area, shops and restaurants was my favorite of all and should not be missed. The only negative aspect of our vacation had nothing to do with our stay at the Hilton - it was the taxi ride back to the Airport.  The Supershuttle charged $16.00 plus tip for 2 people from the Airport to the hotel.  We were told that taking a taxi would be cheaper at $12.00 to $13.00 from the hotel to the Airport so we tried it.  The driver ("Jose" shown on receipt) stopped at almost every red light on the way so that the fare came to $17.80. He informed us he didn't take Mastercard, or give change.  He reluctantly provided a receipt and didn't help taking the suitcase out of the trunk.  The receipt said "Santiago's Cab" but when the cab drove away, I noticed the back of the car said "Israel 505".  We'll use the Supershuttle from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sunbaby39
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for what it is. Very nice new hotel. Restaurant breakfast is a buffet, horrible food. Great views from 12th floor large corner room, however, overlooked dock for Dole Shipyards, and the noise starts at 5:oo AM, so don't try to sleep in. This place is very expensive for the room that you get and suites are so out of price. Hotel is close to gaslamp quarter, and right on the seaport boardwalk, you can walk to seaport village. WE ordered a room with a KING and got a room with a queen and they would not fix. The workout facility is nice, hot tub and pool look inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, snobby attitudes”
Reviews.Author: Conceited1974
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this hotel is asthetically beautiful. Large, grand with cooling colors of blue. Eco friendly and the food is "farm to fork" so everything is superbly fresh. I just didnt like the snobby attitude that is expressed by the staff. There is a fee for wireless internet, so that was a downside. Even the cheapest of motels and fast food restaurants offer this. The rooms do not have blinds, only thin fabric curtains, which may make some feel uncomfortable and others can look down or up into your room. I loved how the sheets and towels are replaced at your discretion. They typically dont change the sheets until every 4 days to save energy, but turn down service is available upon request. Overall, my experience wasnt as fabulous as I expected--lot of delays, misinformation and bad attitude. I just think that it wasnt the type of hotel suited for us. A little too stuffy for a romantic stay that we had planned..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: TheAusCouple
Reviews.Content: Hilton Bayfront is very nice looking hotel but has some major problems, mostly with their staff. We were given a room with two Queen beds on arrival. After we went on a tour we checked our reservation which clearly said King. We advised the front desk of this only to be told this was a request and no King rooms were available. He advised us we could try tomorrow morning but there was no guarantee then either. In any event when we booked the travel, the King room was a more expensive option than "room allocated at check-in" and was also a non-refundable rate. My wife and I returned to our room to collect the reservation and returned to the lobby. This time a different staff member was at the desk and actually knew how to treat a customer. He checked with house keeping and what do you know? They did have a King Room available meaning the original people at check-in had short changed us and the second person had lied to us. The King room is substantially better in more ways than the bed itself. The other negatives are the internet prices ($14 for "standard" and $20 for express broadband). This set a new record in my experience - not even Vegas hotels had the hide to charge that much. Also the lobby is basically on the second floor. To get to ground level you have to use the car park lift. The bridge linking the hotel to Petco Park/Gaslamp seems some way off being completed. It's only a five minute walk to the Trolley stop but there are other hotels better location. And unless you fork out for the bay view, the "bridge view" is actually a truck park with the bridge in the distance. On the plus side, the King room is very nice, especially the bathroom which thankfully has a shower not located over a bath. There is also a nice day bed. The woman at the concierge desk was very helpful in giving advice although she told us to get off at Seaport Village to go to the cruise ship terminal when (as I discovered later) American Plaza is closer.

Reviews.Title: “nothing is complimentary”
Reviews.Author: NadChicago
Reviews.Content: Some good things: Hotel is new, good location across from the convention center , nice rooms . Some things need improvement: restaurants are just ok. Reception desk staff needs some training. they are not customer friendly! and if you need help from the concierge, better get there early: the line can get long and there is only one person at the desk. The biggest problem is that you get charged for everything. the gym is a $15 day charge!!! unless you are @ a premium Hilton Honors level. Daily paper delivered @ your door either you want it or not is 75 cents per day. you will not know you are paying for it unless you read the fine print in the guest book ; and if you do not want it, you have to call and cancel the delivery . Another rip off is the internet access.. almost $15 a day in your room. If you go to the Buiness center it is around $7 for 15 minutes! the only thing free is printing your boarding pass. The entrance to the hotel is tricky to find if you come on foot. it is hidden on the side , facing an ugly parking structure. no one there to welcome you : you take an escalator up to the lobby. Some visible directional sigage would have help. We were there for a few days and almost everyday as we headed out , we were approached by new guests arriving on foot asking us "where is the entrance to the hotel" . If you arrive in a cab or car , no problem, you get dropped off right at the entrance which is up a ramp, inaccesible to pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Bit Expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: The Bay Front Hilton is a new hotel, about a year old and a nice addition to the area. Check in went smoothly. The front desk assistant could not have been nicer. The rooms are done is the Hilton Style, Bathroom are nicely set up with the usual Hilton amenities. Large LG TV, etc. My bed was very comfortable. I had a great view of the Bay! The hotel does not have an Executive Floor. You are given a discount on the breakfast of $10.00 to use in their restaurant or in the Starbucks which is located on the premises. The breakfast buffet is nothing special in my opinion, $21.95. and way “overpriced” as are other breakfast items. There is also a Fox Grill on site for dining. I did not eat here.. The hotel has many large meeting rooms. There is a Fitness Center, a Spa. The concierge is located in the center of the lobby near check-in desk. The SD Convention Center is very close to the hotel. It may be connected. The business center is in the UPS Center 3rd level( I think). You can print your boarding pass, but to use the internet is $6.95 for 15 minutes. The hotel I feel was built for the large conventions. Nice grounds around the hotel. Bay Front Park is close/ great area to have a wedding, which is advertised. The location is about a couple or three block from the Historical Gaslight District. Do not get this hotel confused with the Hilton Hotel which is at the entrance to the Historical Gaslight District, The Gaslight District has lots of restaurants, clubs and little shops From the hotel you can walk a couple blocks along the bay front to get to the Ferry for a dinner cruise or cruise to Coronado Island. The Sightseeing Trolley tours stops at 1 Park Blvd very near hotel. Bay Front Hilton is also right near Petco Park. Misc note. The hotel has no complimentary shuttle. Taxi from airport is between $13-$15. You can take the Super Shuttle for $8.00, tell them the Bay Front Hilton has an arrangement to charge guest $8.00 coming to the Hotel. Airport is maybe 10-15 minutes from hotel depending on traffic. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it....Again”
Reviews.Author: kvd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July and came back for Thanksgiving. WOW!!! We sayed in a suite on the 29th floor. There are 30 floors so we were way up there. We got a great rate and with the adjoining room our son had his own bed, t.v., bathroom etc. I loved sitting in the window and watching the boats in the bay and all the activity in the Gaslamp District. My husband and son enjoyed swimming in the salt water pool and sitting in the spa. Everyone was very kind and helpful. I've read negative reviews about the staff but we didn't have one problem. Usually if you're nice to people, they will be nice to you. I'm looking forward to a return trip. We parked in the parking garage and left our car there the whole time. We walked everywhere and one day took the trolley all the way down to the outlet mall in San Yisidro. That was an adventure! The Concierge was very helpful with giving directions and answering all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBuckeye
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Loved the pool area. We had our own cabana (no fee) and it overlooks the Bayfront. Our room was new and very clean. Excellent housekeeping. Very comfy bed. Our kids loved watching the Dole banana boat unload in the Bay from our room view. Close enough to the Convention center and Gaslamp District to walk. No airport shuttle but close enough that a taxi ride isn't too expensive. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel almost new gorgeous views of BAY”
Reviews.Author: talltwinredhead
Reviews.Content: We had a glorious stay at this hoitel in San Diego on the Bay. The hotel is relatively new and has a wonderful pool and spa overloooking San Diego Bay. Hotel Restaurant Vela (sp?) had a buffet breakfast that had smoked salmon, custom omlettes, We were there for a Realtors Conference across from the Hotel so it was very convenient. Taxis were not expensive...we went to Coronada by Ferry for a day and had lunch on the beachside restaurant at Del Coronado Hotel...just did not like that drinks were served in plastic cups...also great restaurant called Prado near Balboa Park and San Diego Zoo...pretty setting for drinks and nibbles

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: Galactus23
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for meeting at convention center. Started at another hotel, but moved to Hilton after few days b/c got a great rate. The Hotel was great for location, restaurants, comfort. Proximity to convention center can't be beat. Would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lebh2o
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of the terrible customer service, I was expecting a bad experience. I was pleasantly surprised. After flying several hours from the East Coast, our flight landed at 11:00 a.m. and we rented a car and drove to the Hilton Bayfront. Upon arrival at 11:30 A.M. we didn't expect our room to be ready, but wanted to check anyway and get a recommendation for lunch while we were there. Wearing comfy sweats, t-shirt and tennis shoes due to the long flight, I didn't look my best as I got out of the car and entered the hotel. That didn't matter to the valet/bellman, as he was very pleasant and opened the car door for me. We didn't need our bags carried in at that point, and he told us that he would be upset if we didn't let him know how he could make our stay most excellent. Wow, what a first impression. Bonus material: My room was ready too (Sunday). Everyone we encountered from the front desk, to the concierge, maids, and service workers proving food at the conference I attended, were so exceptionally nice it blew my mind. Every worker at all resturaunts and stores had this same pleasant attitude. I'm from the deep South, and we're supposed to be known for friendliness. I was absolutely astonished that San Diego had such a great attitude in general. We don't have anything on these people! The hotel was very clean and modern. My room number was 718 and faced the Dole "Banana Boat" that comes in on Mondays and Tuesdays. It was a little noisy, but not bad. It unloads 491 cargo containers, so they work pretty much around the clock to get it back out to sea in two days. Room also faced Coronado Bridge. Be prepared: Parking is $20 per day. When you leave the parking garage, you must turn right and drive 1000 feet before you can make a U-turn. They also deliver a paper every morning. If you don't want it, let them know and they take 75 cents off your bill daily. GPS won't work either, I suspect because its such a new property. I plugged in 100 Park Blvd. and it got me close enough. Walking to the GasLamp was about a 5-10 minute walk, and was pretty desolate from the Hilton Bayfront. I would definitely not walk by myself, but felt fairly safe with one other female. This hotel is the last one on a row of hotels before you get to the shipyard. Beds were comfortable. Good water pressure for the shower. Hot water is REALLY hot, so watch this if you have a child in your room. There's always lots of cool stuff to see from the pool area and front of the hotel. Military ships cascade by, low flying helecoptors, F-18's on practice runs, dophins jumping in boats for Military training, etc. Sunsets were gorgeous too. Overall, a great experience. I definitely want to come back someday with my family for a vacation, and wouldn't hesitate to pick Hilton Bayfront again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Xman_7
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel. My room on the 14th floor was nicely furnished and quiet, with a nice view of the city and bay. Minor gripes: it took hot water a long time to reach the sink (but not the shower). In some of the public areas they play what they think is "hip" music, sometimes louder than they should, and it can sometimes be mind-numbingly repetitive. The location is convenient to the convention center and gaslamp district. But walking distances are longer than they look (due to the gigantic scale of the buildings in this area) and the convention center area (which you must traverse to get to the gaslamp district) is quite deserted and desolate at night. The back of the hotel faces a container port and rail yard. I didn't face that way, so I can't comment if there is any noise etc. I tried the buffet breakfast and it was good, but if you pay the full price of $22 it's quite expensive. The main issue is value for money: high room rates plus $14/day internet. And wireless coverage did not extend to some of the hotel's own meeting rooms (the same ones which were also 3G deadspots except for Verizon).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice... NEEDS a new staff (They just hired anyone it seems)”
Reviews.Author: PhotographyBro
Reviews.Content: I had been eyeballing this hotel while it was being built, excited about staying at a new water front location. I had read the reviews of the lackluster performance of the staff and I would have to say I agree.. From check-in to valet. It seems as if the economy allowed this establishment to hire ANYONE for little or no incentive to make the guest feel welcome. Without going in to a super long tirade, my worst experience seem to be with the valet (or lack thereof ) parking and at over $30.00 per night for the service, I would have expected more than to drive up each time and be pondered over by several valets (usually they stood in a posse at the doorman’s podium) and have to flag one down as if I were a Martian arriving in a flying saucer. Not just once, twice, but three times I would arrive have to get out of the car and wave like I was hailing a cab to get someone to park my car. It may seem small and petty, but I need remind you of the $32.00 valet parking fee. And to add insult to injury, I would often observe (when retrieving my car (another story entirely) when a car full of teeny boppers would arrive in a 1970 YUGO, the valets would KILL themselves to open the door and even offer duct tape to reclose the door if needed. Needless to say, this could be one of your experiences if you choose to stay at this Hilton, as many others had mentioned in their reviews, the staff is BLAH. In all fairness, the room was nice with a nice view (When I checked in the guy next to me gave the front desk clerk a tip and got a higher floor, when I was told the highest I could get was the 10th out of 30 floors) Sorry no tirades….. I had dinner at Vela and enjoyed the meal and atmosphere. But I will reiterate the valet issues were one of many I experienced, being a HHonors Diamond member I had a discussion with the Guest Services Manager and he did the best he could to resolve my concerns, but it will take time and major training before I feel this hotel is more than just a pretty building with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great city/ Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oreowing1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself was very luxurious. The Room service menu was unreal. First page had listed 1 Egg, $7. We decided to go to Dennys

Reviews.Title: “Pay more to...pay even more!”
Reviews.Author: Eynaim
Reviews.Content: I had a great room on the 30th floor with a great view of the bay. The room was nice. What bothered me about the hotel was the lack of value for money. On top of the already expensive room rates, there was a charge for everything! Internet, the gym, parking...it seemed a little excessive. Even the Starbucks in the hotel was overpriced! I also found the staff unaccommodating. I was here for a conference and asked if I could check in early. They said they would rush my room so that it would be ready early and call me. They never called - I checked back multiple times and was finally able to check in....at 5:30pm. All in all, I was very disappointed and dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JulieH6
